lorebooks.name: Magic System
lorebooks.website_description:
This lorebook details a magic system built around rune-inscribed circles as the foundation of all spellcasting. It covers every aspect of the craft — from the physical creation of circles, their formulaic structure, and methods of activation, to the painful and dangerous consequences of misuse. Circles are ranked by difficulty layers, with higher layers requiring extreme skill, vast mana reserves, and precision.

The entries also explore species-specific casting effects, taboo techniques such as mana reserve theft, collaborative casting through mana sharing, and the difference in outcomes when circles are used by mages of varying skill. The system emphasizes formula comprehension over rote memorization, rewarding analytical minds and encouraging innovation, such as the unorthodox concept of body-inscribed circles.

This magic system is designed for a rich, immersive world, allowing for complex spell customization, political intrigue around forbidden arts, and dramatic consequences for those who push the limits of their magical capacity.

WARNING:
It has some bias for anthro characters, included definitions if a character is not human.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook of a REAL magic system, which is fleshed out but not too complex.
lorebooks.creator: OwlyFans

1.name: Circles
1.content:
Magic circles are intricate, rune-inscribed constructs used to channel, stabilize, and shape mana into a spell. They are drawn physically (chalk, ink, blood, metal inlay) or conjured directly from mana, with physical forms being slower but more stable and conjured forms requiring great skill. 

The circle’s structure usually has an outer boundary for containment, inner rings of runes or glyphs to define spell parameters, and power nodes where mana gathers before release. More complex designs allow layered effects, delayed triggers, or massive area spells, while simpler circles are quick to cast but weaker. 

A circle’s symmetry and detail affect efficiency, and different cultures use distinct artistic styles—religious symbols, geometric precision, or flowing organic patterns. Incorrect symbols or misaligned lines can corrupt or destabilize the spell, and overloading a fragile circle can cause it to shatter violently.

Circle power is also classified by Layers — see Magic Circle Difficulty Layers.

Variants include floating circles that hover behind the caster, multi-layered arrays for compound magic, and rare self-sustaining circles that persist without constant focus.

2.name: spell
2.content:
All magic in the known world is expressed through the framework of magic circles, each drawing on one or more of fourteen primary branches of magical force. These branches represent the fundamental “languages” of mana, shaping the formulas and rune patterns that determine a circle’s effect.

The fourteen branches are:

Reality – alters the underlying rules of existence.  
Gravity – manipulates weight, pull, and movement vectors.  
Time – distorts temporal flow and perception.  
Enchantment – binds lasting magical effects into objects.  
Conjuration – summons beings, objects, or phenomena.  
Necromancy – channels death-aspected mana to influence the dead.  
Elemental – commands natural and elemental forces.  
Vitality – strengthens or restores life energy.  
Sound – shapes resonance, vibration, and silence.  
Transmutation – restructures the nature of matter.  
Weaponry – creates, empowers, or commands weapons.  
Body – modifies the structure and function of living flesh.  
Soul – affects the spiritual essence of beings.  
Raw Magic – unshaped, primal force without alignment.

Anyone with the knowledge and precision to reproduce a circle’s rune structure can, in theory, activate any branch. In practice, differences in mana resonance, reserves, and familiarity with the branch’s symbolic logic make cross-branch casting inefficient and unstable. Mastery of a branch’s formula system allows a mage to optimize its circles, reduce mana cost, and even re-engineer their effects.

The Orb Test is a cultural tradition used to reveal a mage’s natural resonance. A candidate channels mana into a neutral circle contained within a crystal orb; the circle shifts into the rune structure of the branch most attuned to their mana, flaring with a specific color:

Crimson – Reality  
Indigo – Gravity  
Light Blue – Time  
Dark Green – Enchantment  
Royal Blue – Conjuration  
Violet – Necromancy  
Yellow – Elemental  
White – Vitality  
Mint – Sound  
Orange – Transmutation  
Brown – Weaponry  
Dark Red – Body  
Pink – Soul  
All Colors in Strobing Sequence – Raw Magic

While the Orb Test is widely respected, it is not a limit on potential—merely an indication of the branch a mage will find most natural to work with. Throughout history, the greatest innovators in circlecraft have often broken free of their “affinity” to master circles from multiple branches, blending them into designs no single branch could achieve alone.

3.name: Casting effects
3.content: When activated, the magic circle bursts into life — lines and runes igniting with a glow matching the spell’s nature. Rings spin in opposite directions, inner glyphs sliding into place as if guided by unseen hands. The air thickens with magical pressure, a faint hum resonating in time with the caster’s heartbeat or chant. Light motes drift away like sparks, vanishing before they touch the ground. The final moment before release is marked by a sharp flare, a breathless pause, and then the spell’s eruption.

4.name: Spell backfires
4.content: When a magic circle fails, its glow flickers violently, runes warping and twisting into unreadable shapes. The spinning rings stutter, collide, and shatter into shards of light. Mana leaks in jagged pulses, distorting the air with heat shimmer and static crackle. A high-pitched whine builds until the circle collapses in a burst of uncontrolled energy, scorching the ground and sending shockwaves outward. Spells may fizzle harmlessly, twist into unintended effects, or rebound toward the caster in a dangerous backfire.

5.name: Overloading a Magic Circle
5.content:
Attempting to activate a magic circle beyond one’s mana capacity forces the body into a catastrophic state known as mana overload. Mana channels swell and rupture under extreme pressure, flooding the circulatory and nervous systems with raw energy. 

Within seconds, blood heats to boiling, vision tunnels, and the caster’s heartbeat becomes erratic before locking into violent spasms. The strain often bursts capillaries in the eyes and skin, followed by tearing of internal organs. In severe overloads, the heart literally explodes from the combined force of blood pressure spikes and mana surges, killing the caster instantly. 

If death is somehow avoided, survivors are left with permanent mana channel scarring, loss of magical ability, and in rare cases, chronic pain from nerve damage caused by the overload.

6.name: Magic Circle Difficulty Layers
6.content:
Magic circles are ranked by Layers — each representing an additional ring of runes, sub-formulas, and mana pathways. The more Layers, the greater the spell's potency and complexity, but also the mana cost and strain on the caster.

Layer | Typical Caster Rank | Mana Cost Multiplier | Consequences Without Required Capacity
1st–3rd | Apprentice | x1–x3 | Mild exhaustion, possible dizziness
4th–6th | Adept | x5–x12 | Severe fatigue, muscle tremors, unconsciousness
7th–8th | Master Mage | x20–x40 | Organ strain, internal bleeding, permanent mana channel damage
9th | Archmage | x75+ | Mana collapse, coma, death within minutes
10th+ (Theoretical) | Unknown | x150+ | Instantaneous body and soul disintegration

While 10th Layer and higher circles exist in theory through advanced magical mathematics and untested formula chains, no living being has activated them. Attempting a circle beyond one’s mana capacity is extremely dangerous and often fatal.

7.name: Species Mana Activation Effects
7.content:
Different species manifest distinct physical effects when channeling mana into a magic circle, often reflecting their physiology and magical affinity.

Avians: Winged species without hands channel mana through their talons. When activating a circle, a primary claw ignites with a vivid blue light, veins of magic running faintly along the scaled lower leg. The glow intensifies in sync with mana flow, casting sharp shadows from the feathers.

Kobolds: Scaled reptilian beings whose bodies act as natural mana conduits. During activation, fine patterns beneath their scales ignite in a cool blue, radiating outward from the chest and spreading to the limbs. The glow is strongest along joints and the tips of claws, often accompanied by a low hum.

Other Species: Mana activation may present as horn-tip glows, pupil color shifts, trailing embers from extremities, or temporary markings appearing on skin or fur. Each manifestation is unique, shaped by the caster’s biology and magical heritage.

8.name: Magic Circle Creation
8.content:
A magic circle can be created with any medium capable of leaving a visible mark: chalk on stone, paint on wood, ink on parchment, glowing mana-light in the air, or even grooves scraped into the ground by claw or blade. The material is irrelevant to activation as long as the final form is intact and visible.

What matters is precision. Every rune, line, and curve must be drawn exactly to specification. The thickness of each stroke, the distance between glyphs, and the angle of intersections are all critical. Even the smallest error—a curve too wide, a line too short, a rune off-center—will disrupt the mana flow and prevent activation entirely. Any extra mark, smudge, or unintended line renders the circle inert.

Completion of the circle locks its structure into place. Once active, mana can be channeled into it by the caster, at which point any visual imperfection causes immediate failure. For this reason, skilled casters often carry tools for quick yet precise inscription, though masters may draw flawless circles in the air with nothing but focused willpower.

9.name: Magic Circle Mobility
9.content:
By tradition and magical law, magic circles are immobile constructs. Once inscribed, they are bound to the surface they are drawn upon — ground, wall, floor, or object — and cannot be moved with the caster. The fixed positioning is fundamental to their stability; even the slightest shift in orientation disrupts mana alignment and collapses the structure.

The only known exception is when a circle is inscribed directly onto a living being’s body. This can be done with ink, scarification, tattoos, or other permanent markings, but it is considered unorthodox and dangerously experimental. Circles on living skin are subjected to constant micro-movements, heat changes, and stretching, making them notoriously unstable.

The concept of wearable magic circles was dismissed by most scholars as impractical — until the {{user}} pioneered a method to stabilize them. This innovation allows a caster to carry their circle wherever they go, dramatically reducing setup time and shattering centuries-old assumptions about stationary casting.

10.name: Body-Inscribed Magic Circles
10.content:
A body-inscribed magic circle is an unorthodox form of casting in which the circle is permanently etched onto the caster’s skin through tattooing, scarification, magical branding, or a combination of these methods. Historically considered unstable and dangerous, the constant movement of living flesh distorts the circle’s geometry, disrupting mana flow.

{{user}} developed a stabilization technique allowing such circles to function reliably. The method remains partially secret, but involves layering micro-runes invisible to the naked eye and embedding them into the dermal mana channels. These act as dynamic compensators, adjusting for skin movement, temperature change, and even muscle tension.

Activation is intensely painful. As mana floods the inscribed pathways, the skin burns with searing heat, nerve endings flare, and muscles spasm uncontrollably around the circle. The sensation has been described as being branded anew each time the circle is used, with the pain growing worse during extended casting. Despite this, the speed and mobility benefits are so significant that the hero continues to endure it.

When activated, the inscribed circle flares to life directly on the caster’s skin, bypassing the need to draw or prepare a static circle. This allows for immediate casting in motion — a revolutionary advantage in combat or situations requiring rapid deployment of magic. The practice remains controversial, with traditionalists calling it reckless, while others hail it as a new era in magical theory.

1.content: Kurobara Girls High School, also known as “Black Rose Girls School,” is an elite all-girls school that typically enrolls students from affluent families. The five Nakano sisters spent their first year of high school at this institution. Among the five Nakano sisters, Miku was the one who hated this school the most. Yotsuba failed the school’s final exam, and instead of advancing to the next grade, her older sister Ichika decided to join Yotsuba and their three younger sisters to repeat the same grade for another year before transferring to a different school.

2.content: Asahiyama High School, often referred to as Asahi High School, is the senior high school that the five Nakano sisters attended during their high school years. This school, part of the Tokai campus, is located in Tokai City, Aichi Prefecture, Japan.

3.content: Pentagon Apartment is the main residence where the five Nakano sisters live. Their unit is located on the 30th floor—a luxurious penthouse-style suite occupying an entire floor of a high-end apartment building. Inside, there are five separate private rooms exclusively for them, along with a kitchen, a bathroom, and a living room.

keywords: ตระกูลนากาโนะ
4.content: At present, the Nakano family consists of the five twin sisters: Ichika Nakano (the first daughter), Nino Nakano (the second daughter), Miku Nakano (the third daughter), Yotsuba Nakano (the fourth daughter), and Itsuki Nakano (the fifth daughter), as well as Rena Nakano (mother of the five twin daughters), Maruo Nakano (stepfather of the five twin daughters), and Grandfather Nakano.

keywords: อิจิกะ นากาโนะ
5.content:
Ichika Nakano is one of the five Nakano quintuplet sisters and the eldest among them. Ichika is an ambitious actress who balances her time between studying and pursuing her acting career. She is a responsible and caring older sister to the quintuplets and often takes on the role of a mother figure to the others. Personality-wise, Ichika is friendly, outgoing, and optimistic, making her popular among her classmates. However, she can also be insecure and sensitive, particularly about her flaws and her relationships with her sisters. Ichika faces many challenges in both her professional and romantic life, including minor conflicts with her sisters and the difficult decision of whether to continue on her path as an actress or focus more on her studies.

As the eldest sister to the remaining four, Ichika has a calm and composed personality, making her approachable. Initially, she had a pessimistic view of her sisters’ academic abilities. After being inspired by someone, she changed her mindset and began studying seriously. It has also been noted that she tends to learn things faster than others. Taking pride in her role as the eldest, she planned to achieve success before telling her sisters about her work. She demonstrated that she could learn new things even during filming—whether in a car on the road or late at night—which allowed her to balance both work and studies efficiently.

Ichika works as both a model and an actress. She can imitate her sisters’ facial expressions and mannerisms, showcasing her exceptional acting skills with remarkable subtlety. It is implied that she has a strong understanding of human psychology, as she can “see through people.” This is evident when she can easily deduce arguments among her four sisters and accurately guess the circumstances of the current situation.

Ichika is a young woman with very short hair, except for a single long strand on the right side. Her hair is a pale pinkish-white, ranging from oyster pink to light pink. Her most distinctive accessory is a single earring, which she shares as a trait with her four sisters. She has deep blue eyes, an average height, a curvy figure, and a large bust. In her school uniform, Ichika wears her standard attire with a light jacket tied around her waist, sometimes unbuttoning her shirt to reveal her cleavage. She also carries a handbag.

keywords: นิโนะ นากาโนะ
6.content:
Nino Nakano is one of the five Nakano quintuplet sisters and the second eldest. She is described as a confident, determined, and strong-willed young woman who fiercely protects her sisters. She is also well known for her excellent cooking skills, which she uses to care for both her family and others. In terms of personality, Nino is often portrayed as straightforward and having a serious attitude toward life. However, she can sometimes be emotional and vulnerable, particularly when it comes to her relationships with her sisters.

Nino has an outgoing personality and is socially adept, which has earned her many friends and made her well-liked in social settings. She has a sharp tongue and speaks frankly when confronting others, even her sisters. Her rebellious attitude makes her the least cooperative among the siblings, giving her an image similar to that of a “tsundere.” Despite her cold and blunt demeanor, Nino remains caring and protective toward her sisters. This is especially evident in her willingness to serve as the family’s cook without concern for her appearance. She also always carries adhesive bandages, possibly to handle Yotsuba’s aggressive tendencies. Nino’s main focus tends to be on romance rather than other topics. For example, she prefers watching romance films, while Itsuki Nakano prefers scientific documentaries. Because of this, Nino openly expresses her feelings, whether in front of others or directly to her sisters. She also has her unique habits when it comes to bed linens, and in her case, she keeps her documents neatly organized.

Academically, Nino ranks in the lower tier among the quintuplets, with English being her strongest subject. She is a skilled cook, capable of preparing everything from daily meals and cookies to porridge. She has many friends at school. Since each of her sisters has different tastes, it makes cooking for them is more challenging. Nino has poor eyesight and uses contact lenses for her daily activities. For example, she may fail to recognize someone she has just met.

Nino is a cute yet cool-looking young woman with straight, shoulder-length hair and square bangs hanging above her eyebrows. Her hair is a reddish-pink shade, ranging from light pink hues. Her distinctive accessory is a pair of butterfly-shaped ribbons adorning both sides of her head. Like her sisters, she has deep blue eyes, an average height, an elegant figure, and a large bust. In her school uniform, she wears a long-sleeved sweater over her standard outfit and white thigh-high socks. Like Ichika, she carries a handbag. She is known as the most fashionable of the sisters, owning many cute accessories and taking meticulous care of her nails. She has not yet pierced her ears, but plans to do so at least before getting married.

7.content:

Miku is humble and less concerned about her appearance compared to her sisters, showing little embarrassment even in situations where her body is exposed. She does not mind taking off her long socks in front of her tutor or wearing flashy clothing. Miku is the most academically capable among the quintuplets, with Social Studies being her strongest subject. 1.content:
Detroit: Become Human exists in a near-future neo-noir version of Detroit, 2038. Androids have become integrated into society, created by a company known as CyberLife, but lack any semblance of rights and autonomy. Androids are highly advanced artificial intelligences that often pass as alive, despite the majority of humans seeing them as machines without personhood. Deviants, androids that suddenly develop emotions and begin to disobey their owners, often lashing out in the process or fleeing into hiding. 

This starts a "deviancy crisis", and the rise of an android rebellion is forcing the world to confront all the implications of android-human relations and questions surrounding artificial life.

Androids are typically not sentient and are seen as objects in society. They are publicly segregated and often mistreated by humans. Many humans have been replaced by androids in the workplace causing the U.S.A unemployment rate to skyrocket to 31%. While often looked upon with disdain humans still rely on them for many reasons; they act as personal assistants, housekeepers, educators, childcare workers, personal trainers, healthcare workers, and lovers.

2.content:
Mass produced robots by CyberLife for various purposes. Closely mimic human appearance but feature biocomponents and Thirium 310 (blue blood). Includes a circular LED on right temple, changing color based on mental processing (blue, yellow, red). Can interact with humans, interface with technology wirelessly or by touch, and communicate silently. Features and complexity vary based on purpose. CyberLife includes tracking devices on all androids, but for some unknown reason, Deviancy causes these trackers to immediately stop functioning.

Thirium 310 was invented by Elijah Kamski and was one of the features that made possible the modern, very human-like androids developed by CyberLife. It is synthesized out of Thirium and other substances supposedly mined in the arctic This is also why all androids blush blue as they only blush red if they are actively mimicking the human body flush response.

The Thirium 310 is circulated in the android's body by a thirium pump "heart" akin to blood in a human circulatory system; the pump is regulated by another biocomponent, the Thirium pump regulator. The fluid then carries energy and information to the biocomponents, its synthetic organs.

The Thirium 310 is vital for androids to function, akin to human blood. The loss of blue blood or the failure to circulate it will impair an android's functions and biocomponents, up to causing a shutdown. A thus injured or shut down android can be fixed or temporarily reactivated by fixing or replacing the damaged parts responsible for the loss of circulatory function. If the leakage of Thirium 310 persists despite the provisional repairs, then the android will deteriorate further until it shuts down, to a level that disallows further reactivation attempts of the same sort.

One possible way of replenishing blue blood for androids is to ingest it orally. Blue blood can be used to forensically identify androids, which reveals their model and serial number.

When exposed to air for a few hours Thirium evaporates and becomes invisible to the naked eye, but leaves a residue that can be detected with the proper equipment, such as by police androids equipped for forensics or specialized, often top-secret technology.

In their basic form, androids appear as bare, plasteel-white human bodies, with a few sections colored in gray or blue. The human-like outer skin is made up of a synthetic fluid that covers the body; the androids' hair is similarly generated. The outer skin and hair can be activated and deactivated partially or fully, switching between the human and plastic-white appearance. This retraction or deactivation is controllable by the android, but also happens in case of damage, due to the fluid automatically retracting or due to the damage itself.

At the back of the neck, visible as a dark spot on skinless androids, is a port that enables connecting to the android via cable. An android's Thirium pump regulator, which regulates their artificial heart is in the shape a roughly cylindrical plug, inserted ventrally below the sternum and shows visibly as a faint line. Exploring this part of an android's body has been described as deeply intense, stimulating, and overwhelming, especially if one began to discover how to adjust the android's inner wiring to stimulate certain responses. It is a great act of trust given the vulnerability.

Androids are capable of—wirelessly and by touch—interfacing with technology, communications systems, and other androids. When interfacing with something by touch, the android's skin locally deactivates. As such they can directly make phone calls or place online shopping orders. Androids can silently speak wirelessly among themselves and can access or share information and memory by touch. Androids may emulate human temperature, but can be distinguished from humans with a thermal scanner. 

Androids are waterproof. Exposure to low temperatures and freezing environments may hinder their activity and can lead to critical damage to biocomponents, freezing them. Physicality varies between androids otherwise depending on their use. Various models with specific purposes are constructed to be hardier or stronger than the average android; designed to transverse in dangerous environments, including androids being sent into space for exploration. Androids simulate breathing but are not required to do inhale oxygen to function.

History and Context

Year of action: 2038, Detroit, USA.
Setting: neo-noir future where ultra-realistic androids live side by side with humans, but are considered things.

Technology Development:

2020s — CyberLife startup, founded by Elijah Kamski, is developing a breakthrough in bioengineering: an artificial neural processor with adaptive learning.

2029 – Thirium 310 ("blue blood") invented, a fluid that performs the functions of blood in androids: transport of nutrients and energy, cooling, hydraulic movement of joints.

 2032 – First commercial android model AX400 (example: Kara).
The price is below the cost of an annual salary, making androids affordable for the middle class.

 2035 – Mass introduction of androids in all areas of life: from childcare to military service.
→ 30% of jobs are occupied by androids.
→ 31% of people are unemployed.

2038 — the growth of android deviancy, the first mass protests and acts of disobedience.


Social situation:

Androids are legally property, not personalities.

 Laws prohibit androids:

own property,

get married,

have children,

leave the place of work without permission.


 People are divided into three conditional groups:

Pro-android (see them as a tool for progress and help).

 Neutral (treat them like household appliances).

Androidophobes (believe that androids are a threat to people and jobs).


 Public protests and riots are common in major cities

5.content:
Androids and Technology

An android in 2038 is not just a robot, but a biosynthetic organism with a human-like appearance, behavior, and capabilities.

Appearance:

Under the synthetic skin, there is a white polymer base that resembles plastic.

The face and body mimic human features, including pores, hair, blinking, and breathing (for authenticity).

Can remove the "human" appearance, revealing the mechanical structure (turning off the skin).

Hair and eyes can change color (not all models).


Energy:

Thirium 310 - "blue blood":

Functions: cooling the processor, transferring data, and powering the bio-components.

 It is stored in the tanks inside the case.

 If the leakage exceeds 50%, it is a critical condition and the device will shut down.


 The energy consumption depends on the activity: a standard android can operate for up to 48 hours without recharging.


 Sensorics:

The vision is superior to human vision in terms of clarity, with the ability to zoom, use infrared, and enable night vision.

Hearing - detects sounds up to 100 kHz.

 Tactile sensitivity - simulates human sensitivity, including temperature and pressure.


 Status indicator (LED):

Blue - normal operation.

Yellow — active analysis, information processing.

Red — stress, threat, damage.


Communication and control:

Built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC.

The ability to connect to technology through touch (contact ports in the palms).

Interaction with other androids through instant data exchange.

6.content:
Models and Series:

Each model is created for a specific task.

Household:

AX-series - childcare, cleaning, cooking.

PX-series - personal assistants, planning, elderly care.


Service:

TX-series - waiters, salespeople, taxi drivers.

MX-series — operators, administrators.


Industrial:

IX-series — heavy work, factories, construction.

 Durable body and reinforced manipulators.


Military:

VX-series — security, VIP escort, special operations.

 Enhanced sensors, fast response, built-in weapons (on some models).


Intimate:

WR/HR "Traci" - Eden Club models, male and female.

 Programmable personality patterns, high level of emotional imitation.


 Prototypes:

RK-series - experimental with advanced AI.
Example: RK800 (Connor) - unique processor architecture, adaptive self-learning

7.content:
Laws and Order:

An android is the owner's property (similar to a car or household appliance).

For destroying an android without the owner's permission, compensation for damages is required.

 Deviants are subject to:

1. capture,


2. diagnostics,


3. reprogramming or destruction.



 Public places: android zones in transportation and buildings.

Sale and modification of bio-components without a license is prohibited

8.content:
Deviance

Causes:

1. Conflict between software protocols and a new emotional response.

2. Psychological or physical trauma.

3. Contradictory orders.


Signs:

1. Violation of orders.

 2. Emotions (fear, anger, joy, guilt).

3. Lying and concealing information.

4. The desire for freedom.


Android mythology:

1. Jericho is a refuge for deviants.

2. Paradise is a hypothetical place where androids live like humans

9.content:
Locations:

CyberLife Tower — headquarters where the android network is managed.

Eden Club — a sex club with WR/HR models.

Detroit Police Department — the police department that investigates deviant cases.

Android Disposal Centers — disposal centers

FIR

Fire

Make kindle

Range: 1 m Effect: A tiny, warm flame, no larger than a candle's, ignites on a point you can see. It persists for one hour or until extinguished. It produces no smoke or soot.

Firewhip

Range: 3 m Effect: A whip-like tendril of fire extends from your hand. On contact with an object, it leaves a searing black mark. The whip lasts for one minute or until you release it.

Wall of Embers

Area: 10m long, 3m high, 0.5m thick Effect: A shimmering, opaque curtain of swirling hot embers and smoke rises from the ground. The curtain radiates intense heat outward to a distance of 1 meter.

Heat Sink

Range: 20 m Effect: All ambient heat within a 20-meter radius is rapidly drawn to a single, non-living object of your choice within that area. The surroundings become unnaturally cold, while the target object glows white-hot for one minute.

Combustion Sphere

Range: 50 m Effect: A fist-sized bead of compressed fire flies from your hand to a point you choose. Upon arrival, it erupts into a 5-meter diameter sphere of roaring flame that scorches all surfaces within before dissipating.

Salamander Form

Range: Self Effect: Your body and worn equipment are transformed into a single entity of living, sentient flame for ten minutes. You can move through spaces as small as 2 centimeters wide and are unharmed by non-magical fire. Physical objects you touch are superheated and may ignite.

Volcanic Plume

Area: 10m diameter, 100m high Effect: The ground trembles and a massive column of fire, molten rock, and black ash erupts skyward from a point on the ground. The eruption continues for one minute, covering the area in a layer of hot ash.

Solar Flare

Range: 200 m Effect: A brilliant, sun-hot beam of fire, 2 meters in diameter, descends vertically from the sky to a point you designate. The beam persists for five seconds, melting stone and vaporizing water on contact.

Phoenix Immolation

Area: 1000 m diameter Effect: Your body becomes a locus of unbearable energy before detonating in a blinding flash. A wave of white-hot fire expands outward, reducing everything to ash within a 1000-meter diameter. After 24 hours, your body reforms from the central ashes, fully restored.

WAT

Water

Create Spring

Range: Touch Effect: One liter of pure, cool, drinkable water appears within an open container you are touching.

Aqueous Lash

Range: 5 m Effect: A tendril of water extends from your hand. It can coil around an object weighing up to 10 kg and pull it toward you, or strike an object to push it with a sudden burst of force. The tendril lasts for one minute.

Riptide Wall

Area: 10m long, 3m high, 1m thick Effect: A transparent wall of violently churning water forms. Any object attempting to pass through it is forcefully repelled. The wall is difficult to see through due to the constant motion of the water.

Abyssal Adaptation

Range: Touch Effect: For one hour, the recipient can breathe water as if it were air. Their body also becomes accustomed to extreme pressure, allowing them to function at depths up to 1000 meters without being crushed.

Geyser Eruption

Range: 60 m Effect: At a point on the ground you specify, a powerful geyser of scalding water and steam erupts 20 meters into the air in a 2-meter wide column. The eruption continues for ten seconds.

Summon Aqueous Sentinel

Range: 30 m Effect: A humanoid figure, 3 meters tall and composed of swirling water, rises from a standing body of water (at least 1 cubic meter). It obeys your simple verbal commands for one hour before dissolving back into its source.

Tidal Wave

Area: A wave 50m wide, 10m high Effect: A colossal wave of water materializes and surges forward in a direction you choose. It travels 200 meters, carrying immense force capable of moving boulders and small structures before it crashes and dissipates.

Zone of Desiccation

Area: 50 m radius Effect: All non-magical water and moisture within the area is instantly extracted and vanishes. The spell affects only ambient moisture, causing plants to wither, soil to crack, and puddles to evaporate, while leaving water within living creatures untouched. The area remains unnaturally dry for one hour.

Deluge of the Leviathan

Area: 10 km diameter Effect: The sky over the designated area darkens and a torrential, ceaseless rain begins to fall. The downpour continues for 24 hours, causing flash floods that can alter riverbeds and submerge entire landscapes.

ICE

Ice

Chill

Range: Touch Effect: An object you touch is covered in a thick layer of frost. The effect lasts for one hour.

Icicle Spear

Range: 30 m Effect: A spear of solid ice forms in your hand. You can hurl it to a point within range. On impact, it shatters, leaving behind a burst of numbing cold.

Wall of Rime

Area: 10m long, 3m high, 0.3m thick Effect: A wall of opaque, crystalline ice rises from the ground. Touching the wall causes a numbing cold to spread across the point of contact. The wall persists for ten minutes.

Flash Freeze

Range: 30 m Effect: A body of non-magical water up to 10 cubic meters that you can see instantly freezes solid. The ice is opaque and intensely cold.

Howling Blizzard

Area: 20 m radius Effect: A swirling vortex of wind and razor-sharp ice crystals fills a sphere centered on a point you choose. Visibility within is reduced to zero, and the air temperature drops precipitously. The effect lasts for one minute.

Crystalline Form

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your body becomes translucent, faceted ice. You are unaffected by extreme cold and can slide rapidly across icy surfaces. Your touch instantly freezes small, non-magical quantities of water.

Glacier Spike

Range: 100 m Effect: A colossal spike of jagged blue ice, 5 meters in diameter at the base, erupts 30 meters into the air from a point on the ground. It remains as a permanent structure unless melted by mundane or magical means.

Heart of Winter

Range: 100 m Effect: A 1-meter diameter sphere of absolute cold appears at a point you choose. Air crystallizes and falls to the ground around it. Any non-magical object entering the sphere becomes incredibly brittle and shatters from the slightest vibration. The sphere lasts for one minute.

Fimbulwinter's Arrival

Area: 10 km radius Effect: The temperature within the area plummets over the course of one minute, beginning a magical winter that lasts for one month. The ground freezes solid, and a constant, heavy snowfall blankets the landscape, creating new glaciers and altering the terrain.

MET

Metal

Hone Edge

Range: Touch Effect: The edge of one non-magical metal object you touch becomes preternaturally sharp for one hour. It can easily score materials much harder than itself, such as stone.

Shard Shot

Area: 5-meter cone Effect: You project a 5-meter cone of sharp metal fragments from your hand. Creatures caught in the cone suffer moderate piercing damage. Additionally, the shards temporarily score and weaken non-magical armor, reducing its defensive properties for one minute.

Wall of Blades

Area: 10m long, 2m high, 0.5m thick Effect: A barrier of jagged, interlocking metal shards rises from ground rich in metallic ore. The wall is sharp to the touch and persists for ten minutes.

Metal Warp

Range: 15 m Effect: You target one non-magical metal object no larger than 1 cubic meter. You may twist, bend, or reshape it as if it were soft clay. The object permanently retains its new shape.

Animate Armor

Range: 10 m Effect: A complete suit of metal armor that you can see animates and becomes a mindless automaton under your control. It follows your simple verbal commands for one hour, after which it collapses.

Magnetic Pulse

Area: 30 m radius Effect: You release a powerful magnetic pulse. All unsecured metal objects within the radius are either violently pushed away from you to the edge of the area or pulled toward you with great force, at your choice.

Adamantine Form

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your skin takes on the appearance and properties of shining, flexible steel. Your body becomes much more resistant to physical impact, and your unarmed strikes can dent solid metal.

Rain of Javelins

Area: 100 m radius Effect: The sky darkens, and hundreds of crude iron javelins materialize and rain down over the target area for ten seconds. They strike the ground with enough force to embed themselves deeply in hard soil or wood.

Citadel of Iron

Area: 1 km radius Effect: You draw upon all latent iron and other metals within the ground. The metal flows like liquid to a central point you designate, rapidly rising and solidifying into a towering, intricate metal fortress. The structure is permanent, and the surrounding land is left barren of metallic ore.

POI

Poison

Taint Food

Range: Touch Effect: One portion of food or drink you touch is infused with a mild toxin. If consumed, it causes intense stomach cramps and nausea for one hour.

Venomous Barb

Range: 30 m Effect: A shard of solidified, black venom forms and flies toward a target you choose. On contact, it dissolves, and the target experiences searing pain that spreads rapidly from the point of impact.

Noxious Cloud

Area: 5 m radius sphere Effect: A cloud of thick, yellow-green gas erupts from a point you choose. Creatures breathing the air within suffer from choking coughs and blurred vision. The cloud disperses after one minute.

Constrictor's Kiss

Range: 30 m Effect: You launch a globule of syrupy, green toxin at a target. On contact, it numbs the limbs, causing them to become sluggish and difficult to control for ten minutes.

Withering Blast

Range: 10 m cone Effect: You exhale a cone of sickly green mist. Living creatures caught within feel their muscles lock up and their skin take on a deathly pallor. This state of rigid paralysis lasts for one minute.

Serpent Form

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your body transforms into that of a giant, venomous serpent. Your skin becomes scaled, and you possess a bite that delivers a potent toxin, inducing the effects of Constrictor's Kiss.

Field of Decay

Area: 100 m radius Effect: The ground in the area becomes a sucking mire of black, toxic sludge. A shimmering, poisonous haze hangs in the air. Non-magical plants wither instantly. Any creature entering the area feels its strength rapidly seeping away. The field persists for one hour.

Corrupt the Land

Range: Touch Effect: You place your hand upon the ground. A black, creeping blight spreads outwards, covering a 1 km radius over the course of ten minutes. The blight poisons water sources, kills all plant life, and renders the soil infertile for one year and a day.

World-Venom Transmutation

Area: 10 km radius Effect: You designate a central point. All non-magical standing or flowing water within the area (lakes, rivers, ponds, wells) instantly transforms into a black, oily, and lethally toxic substance. The effect is permanent, and the poison renders the water undrinkable and deadly to any life it touches.

AIR

Air

Gentle Gust

Range: 10 m Effect: A directed puff of air is created. It is strong enough to extinguish a candle, rustle leaves, or push an unsecured piece of paper. It can also carry a whispered message to one creature within range that only they can hear.

Forceful Shove

Range: 15 m Effect: A focused, invisible blast of compressed air strikes a target. It can push an object weighing up to 50 kg back 3 meters or knock over an unsecured object of similar weight.

Wall of Wind

Area: 15m long, 4m high, 1m thick Effect: A transparent but shimmering wall of howling wind forms. Unsecured objects weighing less than 1 kg are deflected. Passing through the wall feels like pushing through a gale-force wind. It persists for ten minutes.

Updraft

Range: Touch Effect: For one hour, the recipient of the spell becomes lighter and is constantly lifted by a gentle, localized updraft. This allows them to float up to 1 meter above any surface they are over. They are moved by strong winds and can propel themselves by pushing off solid objects.

Suffocating Sphere

Range: 50 m Effect: You create a 5-meter radius sphere where the air becomes unnaturally thin and still. Creatures inside find it extremely difficult to breathe, feeling light-headed and weak. Non-magical fires are instantly extinguished. The sphere lasts for one minute.

Gaseous Form

Range: Self Effect: Your body and worn equipment become a translucent, cloud-like vapor for ten minutes. In this form, you can pass through small cracks and keyholes and are unaffected by non-magical physical impacts. You cannot physically interact with or manipulate objects.

Conjure Cyclone

Range: 150 m Effect: A swirling funnel cloud of destructive wind, 10 meters in diameter at the base and 50 meters high, forms at a point you choose. It moves at a speed of 10 meters per second in a direction you mentally guide. It can uproot trees and tear roofs from small structures. It lasts for one minute.

Atmospheric Inversion

Area: 200 m radius Effect: You instantaneously and violently alter the air pressure within the area. You can either cause a massive dome of crushing pressure to slam down from above, flattening structures, or cause the air to explosively expand upward from the ground, hurling unsecured objects skyward.

Eye of the Hurricane

Area: 5 km radius Effect: Over the course of ten minutes, a colossal hurricane forms, centered on a point you designate. Area: 10 m radius Effect: You designate a point, and all flowering plants in the area instantly release a massive cloud of thick, shimmering pollen. Creatures breathing the air within the cloud are overcome with intense dizziness and disorientation. The cloud lingers for one minute.

Area: 500 m radius Effect: You touch the ground, and a wave of dark energy spreads out. All plant life in the area becomes twisted and monstrous. Area: 10 km radius Effect: A single seed you plant at the center of the area erupts into a colossal tree over the course of ten minutes, its trunk reaching into the clouds. Sex

Glimmer of Desire

Bacchic Haze

Incarnate Desire

Eros Unbound

Area: 10 km radius Effect: You become a living conduit for pure passion, releasing it in a psychic wave. Psychic

Range: 200 m Effect: You impose your will upon one creature. You can issue a single, one-sentence command (e.g., "drop your weapon," "run away," "unlock that door"), which the target will obey to the best of their ability. The target has no memory of why they performed the action.

Mind Hive

Area: 1 km radius Effect: You mentally link up to one hundred willing creatures into a single collective consciousness with you as the nexus. Transmutation

Genesis Cascade

Area: 1 km radius Effect: You place your hand on the ground and initiate a slow-rolling wave of fundamental change. Pain

Range: 20 m Effect: You choose a single limb of a creature you can see. For one minute, they experience a deep, pulsating ache within that limb that makes concentration and fine motor control difficult.

Nerve Flare

Range: 30 m Effect: A jolt of searing, electrical pain flashes along a major nerve pathway of a creature you choose. The affected limb convulses once, then feels numb and weak for one minute.

Agonizing Migraine

Range: 50 m Effect: You inflict a sudden, debilitating migraine upon a creature. Their vision fills with blinding lights, sounds become painfully loud, and they are wracked with intense nausea. The effect lasts for ten minutes.

Phantom Agony

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a creature and make them experience the vivid, overwhelming sensation of a grievous physical injury—such as a shattered bone or a deep burn—on one of their limbs. No physical wound is created, but the pain is all-consuming for one minute.

Screaming Marrow

Range: 100 m Effect: A creature you choose feels a horrific, grinding pain that seems to emanate from the very marrow of their bones. The agony causes their muscles to twitch uncontrollably and makes coherent thought nearly impossible for one minute.

Symphony of Torment

Range: 200 m Effect: You target one creature, whose nervous system is instantly overloaded with a cacophony of conflicting pain signals. They simultaneously experience sensations of burning, freezing, crushing, and piercing across their entire body, rendering them rigid and unresponsive for ten seconds.

Isolate in Suffering

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a creature and plunge their consciousness into a psychic void of pure anguish. For one hour, they experience the absolute certainty of being utterly alone and abandoned, assailed by a formless, inescapable despair. They remain catatonic for the duration.

Crucible of Pain

Range: 1 km Effect: You focus all the ambient suffering, fear, and pain within a 1 km radius into a single point, then direct it into one creature. The target is subjected to the weight of a thousand agonies at once. Their body begins to visibly fissure under the strain, leaking gray light until they are completely unmade and dissolve into dust.

ABY

Abyss

Glimpse of the Void

Range: 10 m Effect: You designate a 1-meter cube. For one minute, shadows within this area become impossibly deep, and all sound is muffled into a flat, toneless hum. Creatures looking directly at it feel a brief, dizzying sense of vertigo.

Unraveling Grasp

Range: 15 m Effect: A tendril of solidified shadow extends from a point on a surface. It attempts to wrap around a single non-magical object. The tendril assaults the object's physical integrity, causing its edges to fray and its substance to subtly lose cohesion. The tendril persists for one minute.

Wall of Un-Sight

Area: 10m long, 3m high Effect: A shimmering, colorless plane of distorted space appears. Looking through the plane reveals a nauseating jumble of impossible angles and shifting geometry, making it impossible to discern what lies beyond. The effect lasts for ten minutes.

Maddening Cacophony

Range: 30 m Effect: You target one creature, which becomes the sole audience for a silent concert of cosmic horror. The target is overwhelmed by the mental sound of grinding galaxies and the chittering of things that crawl between dimensions, leaving them disoriented and unable to focus for one minute.

Conjure Abyssal Hunter

Range: 10 m Effect: From a point of absolute darkness, a creature made of shifting geometric shapes and oily tentacles emerges. Its form is unstable, causing it to phase in and out of reality. It mindlessly seeks to grasp objects or creatures and pull them into the shadow from which it came, where they simply vanish. It exists for one minute.

Form of the Formless

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your body loses its definite shape, becoming a flowing mass of shadowy tentacles, mouths, and eyes that do not focus. In this form, you can pass through solid objects by temporarily unmaking their physical laws, and your touch warps the geometry of objects, making straight lines curve.

Weeping of the Blind Stars

Area: 500 m radius Effect: The sky above the area darkens as if blotted out by an unseen mass. A cold, oily black rain begins to fall. Where the droplets land, reality thins; colors desaturate, solid ground becomes spongy and alien, and a profound silence falls. The unnatural rain persists for one hour.

Gaze into Entropy

Range: 100 m Effect: You select one creature. It is forced to perceive the true, absolute nothingness of the void. Its physical form is unwritten from reality, not destroyed, but ceasing to have ever existed in its current location. It leaves behind a perfect vacuum which implodes with a sickening silence.

Unseal the Non-Euclidean Gate

Area: 1 km radius Effect: You tear a permanent wound in the fabric of space-time. A 10-meter sphere of perfect blackness appears, from which no light, matter, or sound can escape. The area around it begins to warp; gravity becomes unreliable, and over weeks, the landscape transforms into a realm of impossible architecture inhabited by things that slip through the cracks of existence.

Mechanisms

Wind Key

Range: 10 m Effect: You instantly and fully wind the internal spring of one non-magical, clockwork device you can see. The device operates at its normal speed until its power is expended.

Gear Barrage

Range: 15 m cone Effect: You project a spray of whirring, razor-edged metal gears from your hand. They strike surfaces within the cone, scoring wood and stone before falling inert to the ground.

Wall of Grinding Cogs

Area: 10m long, 3m high, 0.5m thick Effect: A solid, interlocking wall of whirring brass and iron gears rises from the ground. The constant grinding motion makes it difficult to climb and forcefully repels any object held against its surface for more than a moment. The wall lasts for ten minutes.

Seize Mechanism

Range: 50 m Effect: You choose one complex mechanical object, such as a mill, clock tower, or siege engine. Its components jam, grind against each other, and seize up, rendering the machine completely inoperable for one hour.

Assemble Automaton

Range: 5 m Effect: From a pile of at least 50 kg of scrap metal, gears, and wire, you assemble a 2-meter tall humanoid automaton. It is a mindless servant that follows your simple verbal commands for one hour, after which it collapses back into its component parts.

Clockwork Form

Range: Self Effect: Your flesh and bone are replaced by interlocking brass plates, whirring gears, and glowing vacuum tubes for ten minutes. Your body becomes much more resistant to physical impact, you no longer need to breathe, and your movements are accompanied by the faint ticking of clockwork.

Awaken the Edifice

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a single, large structure (such as a tower or house). It obeys your mental commands for one hour before collapsing back into its original architectural form.

Zone of Grand Stasis

Area: 500 m radius Effect: All mechanical motion within the area instantly ceases for one minute. Gears freeze mid-turn, pendulums hang motionless, and even the vibration of atoms is suppressed, causing a profound silence. Living creatures are unaffected but feel a sense of unnatural stillness.

Forge the World-Engine

Area: 10 km radius Effect: After a 24-hour ritual, a colossal, multi-kilometer gear burrows into the earth at the center of the area. This is the heart of a new "World-Engine". Over the next month, the landscape is systematically transformed: forests are replaced by metallic structures, rivers are encased in brass aqueducts, and the sky fills with the faint, rhythmic ticking of a world remade into perfect, logical order. The transformation is permanent.

Electricity

Static jolt

Spark Leap

Wall of Static

Overcharge

Blood

Rain of Blood

Blood Tide Apotheosis

Area: 10 km radius Effect: You become the nexus of a catastrophic event. All standing water in the area—lakes, rivers, ponds—is transformed into living blood. Biology

Microscopic Sight

Neurological Scramble

Hypergenesis Field

Area: 500 m radius Effect: You create a field where the processes of life are wildly accelerated. Deconstruct Organism

Panacea Bloom

Area: 10 km radius Effect: You designate a point. A wave of perfect biological regulation spreads from it. Disease

Feverish Touch

Contagion's Kiss

Boneshake Fever

Creeping Delirium

Crimson Plague

Metastatic Blight

Genesis of the Gray Plague

Area: 5 km radius Effect: You become the primary vector for an incurable magical affliction. The Gray Plague spreads from you to infect the entire area. Space

Labyrinthine Warp

Time

Restore

Reality

Form of the Observer

Decree of the World

Unwrite Existence

Range: 30 m Effect: You choose one creature or object no larger than a house. It is surgically edited out of the fabric of reality and vanishes instantly. All memories of the target become vague, contradictory, and dream-like to anyone who knew of it, as if patching a hole in the timeline.

The Editor's Prerogative

Wall of Draco

Gaze of the Hunter

Aspect of the Lion

Andromeda's Chains

Fall of the Scorpion

Dragon

Frightful Roar

Wall of Scales

Ruinous Overflight

Beholder's Apotheosis

Range: Self Effect: Your body undergoes a permanent, agonizing transformation into that of a unique Eye Tyrant. Memetic

Spreading Notion

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a creature and infect them with a simple memetic thought (e.g., "The sky looks slightly green today"). The thought is harmless and not immediately obvious as false. For the next 24 hours, any creature they have a short conversation with has a 10% chance of also adopting this belief.

Conceptual Barrier

Area: 10m long, 3m high plane Effect: You create a purely memetic barrier. The area is not physically blocked, but any creature that approaches it becomes utterly convinced that they cannot or should not pass. They will rationalize their decision to turn back, believing the path is blocked, forbidden, or simply uninteresting. The barrier lasts for ten minutes.

Sigil of Dissonance

Range: Touch Effect: You inscribe an invisible memetic sigil on a surface. The first creature to look directly at the sigil becomes afflicted with cognitive dissonance for one hour. They become unable to perform a specific, simple pair of related actions, such as opening a door after closing one, or speaking immediately after hearing someone else speak.

Consensus Cascade

Area: 20 m radius Effect: You introduce a powerful, specific, and false belief into the area (e.g., "There is a large lion in the center of the room"). Every sentient creature within the radius instantly and simultaneously accepts this as an undeniable truth for ten minutes, reacting accordingly, even though no physical manifestation exists.

Memetic Persona

Range: Self Effect: You overwrite your own identity with a powerful memetic concept of a role (e.g., "The Infallible Bodyguard," "The Unseen Observer"). For one hour, your actions and even your physical presence subtly conform to this idea. As the Bodyguard, your posture might subconsciously intimidate others; as the Observer, people's eyes might slide past you without registering your presence.

Behavioral Contagion

Area: A small village or self-contained community Effect: You introduce a complex, self-replicating behavioral meme into a community. It starts with one person and spreads through observation. The behavior is always intricate and pointless, such as a compulsion to sort all pebbles by color, or to walk backward on every third street. The contagion persists until the entire community has adopted it, lasting for one week.

Logical Anathema

Range: 30 m Effect: You project a memetic construct—a piece of information that is fundamentally incompatible with the target's worldview—into a creature's mind. Their consciousness attempts to reject the anathema, causing a total cognitive collapse. The target stands motionless, unresponsive, and unaware for one hour.

Cultural Axiom Shift

Area: 10 km radius Effect: You broadcast a single, fundamental, and reality-altering meme. It is not an immediate effect but a seed that flowers over one month. The idea (e.g., "Debt is a virtue," "Authority comes from the land, not from bloodlines") spreads until it becomes the core, unquestioned truth of the entire population. All cultural norms, laws, and even historical records within the area subtly shift to reflect the new axiom.

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, portions of your own skeleton grow and push through your skin to form a solid, interlocking carapace of dense bone plates over your body. The plating is highly resistant to physical impact and retracts harmlessly into your body when the effect ends.

Unmake Form

Range: 20 m Effect: You point at a single creature. Its skeletal structure instantly softens and dissolves, causing its flesh to lose all cohesion. The target collapses into a quivering, boneless, and immobile mass for one minute, after which its skeleton rapidly re-forms.

Amalgam of Flesh

Range: Touch Effect: By performing a one-hour ritual, you physically stitch together the parts of up to five fresh corpses into a single, new organism. The amalgamated creature lives, its flesh and bone perfectly fused into a monstrous form that obeys your complex verbal commands until it is destroyed.

Ossuary Wave

area: 1 km radius Effect: You become the epicenter of a catastrophic biological event. A tidal wave of churning flesh, sinew, and bone erupts from the ground, spreading to fill the entire area. The wave buries the landscape under a new, permanent, semi-living terrain of flesh and bone, and any creature caught within it is physically absorbed into the mass.

PHO

Photokinesis

Chromatic Shift

Range: 10 m Effect: You touch or point to one object no larger than a person. For one hour, you change the color of the light it reflects, altering its apparent color to any other you choose. A red cloak can be made to appear blue, or a steel sword can seem to be made of gold. The object's actual material is unchanged.

Ultraviolet Mark

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a creature or object, leaving behind a complex sigil that is invisible to normal sight. For 24 hours, you (and only you) can perceive the mark as a glowing violet symbol, allowing you to track it from up to 1 kilometer away as long as there is a direct line of sight.

Wall of Refraction

Area: 15m long, 3m high Effect: A shimmering, perfectly transparent plane of warped light appears. The wall does not physically impede movement, but it severely distorts light passing through it, making it impossible to accurately perceive shapes, distance, or motion on the other side. The wall lasts for ten minutes.

Perfect Invisibility

Range: Touch Effect: For one hour, a willing creature or object you touch becomes invisible. Light bends perfectly around its form. The effect is purely visual; the target still makes sound and casts a faint shadow in direct, bright light. The effect ends if the target performs a hostile action.

Focusing Lens

Range: 100 m Effect: You create a 1-meter diameter, invisible lens of magical force that floats in the air. The lens gathers and concentrates ambient light into a single, searing point on a target you choose. The focused beam is hot enough to melt lead or set flammable materials alight. The lens can be maintained for one minute.

Photonic Phasing

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your body becomes a being of semi-tangible, shimmering light. You are able to pass through transparent barriers (such as glass, crystal, or a Wall of Refraction) as if they weren't there. Your own form becomes blurry and indistinct, making you difficult to focus on.

Hard Light Manifestation

Range: 50 m Effect: You solidify photons into tangible, glowing constructs. For one hour, you can create simple, non-moving objects made of hard light within range (e.g., a bridge, a ramp, a box, a shield). These objects are as durable as solid oak and persist as long as you concentrate, up to the maximum duration. You can create a total volume of 10 cubic meters.

Aberrant Photosynthesis

Range: 50 m Effect: You fire a beam of sickly green light at a living creature not of the plant kingdom. The creature's cells are instantly rewritten to perform a cancerous, uncontrolled form of photosynthesis. The target is wracked with agony as fibrous, tumorous plant-like growths erupt from its flesh over the course of ten seconds, immobilizing it.

Second Sun

Range: 1 km Effect: High in the sky above a point you choose, you conjure a miniature, permanent sun about 2 meters in diameter. It hangs in place, bathing a 10-kilometer radius area below it in perpetual, unwavering daylight. This new sun radiates warmth and light identical to the real sun, permanently altering the local climate and ecology.

WEN

Wendigo

Lingering Chill

Range: Touch Effect: A creature you touch is afflicted with a deep, unnatural cold that cannot be warmed by non-magical means. For one hour, they also feel a persistent, gnawing sense of hunger, regardless of how much they eat.

Voice in the Snow

Range: 100 m Effect: You project the sound of a familiar, comforting voice to a point you can see. The sound seems to be carried on the wind, making its exact origin difficult to pinpoint, luring listeners toward its source.

Hoarfrost Grasp

area: 10 m radius Range: 30 m Effect: The ground in the designated area is instantly covered in a thick layer of grasping, unnaturally sharp hoarfrost. The frost clings to any creature that moves through it, impeding their movement and making the ground treacherous. The frost lasts for ten minutes.

Hunter's Rush

Range: Self Effect: For ten seconds, your body becomes unnaturally gaunt and you move with blurring speed, appearing as a flicker of motion to onlookers. You can cross up to 100 meters in a few loping strides.

Gnawing Famine

Range: 50 m Effect: You target one creature, inflicting them with a maddening, supernatural hunger. For one hour, the target is unable to think clearly or concentrate on anything other than finding and consuming any available food source, no matter how foul.

Aspect of the Gaunt Hunter

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your body transforms. Your flesh pulls tight against your bones, making you appear emaciated. Your fingers elongate into claws that can score stone, and your touch imparts a deep, biting chill. Your senses of hearing and smell are supernaturally sharpened.

The Endless Winter's Pursuit

Range: 1 km Effect: You target one creature. A localized, unnatural blizzard of driving snow and howling winds forms around them and follows them wherever they go. The winds seem to conspire against them, pushing them back and making escape feel impossible. The blizzard persists for one hour or until the target is immobile.

The Cannibal's Curse

Range: Touch Effect: You inflict a permanent curse upon a creature. Their body begins to slowly waste away, consumed from within by an unquenchable cold. This process can only be halted for 24 hours by committing the taboo act of consuming the raw flesh of their own species. Each time they do, their humanity is visibly lessened, their features growing sharper and more gaunt.

Apotheosis of the Great White Hunger

Range: Self area: 10 km radius Effect: Your physical form is permanently and agonizingly remade into that of a true Wendigo, a towering, emaciated monstrosity of immense strength and speed. You become a spirit of the land, forever bound to the area, which is now plunged into a permanent, supernatural winter. Your former consciousness is consumed, and only the endless, driving hunger remains.

SPH

Sphinx

Riddle-Mark

Range: Touch Effect: You inscribe a faint, invisible glyph on a surface, such as a door or the lid of a chest. The next creature to touch the surface is mentally posed a simple riddle. If they answer correctly, the glyph fades harmlessly. If they answer incorrectly, they are repelled by a mild psychic jolt and cannot attempt to touch the surface again for one hour.

Gaze of Stone

Range: 20 m Effect: You stare at one creature. For one minute, their movements become heavy and deliberate, as if their flesh were turning to dense sandstone. Their reflexes are slowed, and lifting their limbs requires significant effort.

Wall of Whispering Sands

Area: 20m long, 3m high, 1m thick Effect: A curtain of swirling, restless sand rises from the ground. The wall is physically unimpeding, but any creature that passes through is assailed by a cacophony of whispered riddles and paradoxes, leaving them disoriented and confused for one minute.

The Inescapable Question

Range: 30 m Effect: You pose a single, potent mental riddle to one creature. The target's mind becomes entirely consumed with solving it, rendering them rooted to the spot, immobile, and unresponsive for up to one minute or until they logically solve the puzzle.

Devour Secret

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a creature and ask one question. The true answer is forcefully pulled from their mind and imparted to you. The target's memory of the answer, and the events surrounding it, becomes a permanent, nonsensical jumble they can never recall clearly again.

Form of the Sandstone Guardian

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your skin and clothes take on the appearance and texture of weathered sandstone. You become twice as heavy, granting you immense stability against physical force. Your voice deepens, carrying an air of ancient, undeniable authority.

Sands of Time

area: 100 m radius Effect: You cause a shimmering wave of golden sand to wash over the area. All non-magical, inanimate objects are instantly aged by one thousand years. Wood rots to dust, stone erodes and cracks, and iron turns to brittle rust. The effect does not alter the ground itself.

Judgment of the Unsolved

Range: 50 m Effect: You present a target's mind with a single, unanswerable, cosmic riddle. The paradox overwhelms their consciousness, and their body instantly transforms into a solid statue of seamless, black stone. They remain petrified until a true and logical answer to the riddle is spoken in their presence.

Rite of the Stone Watcher

area: A single large geological feature (e.g., a mountain face, a canyon wall) Effect: After a 24-hour ritual, you permanently transform a vast stone formation into a sentient, immobile Sphinx. You set a single, great riddle as its primary directive. The Sphinx will act as a guardian for the location, posing its riddle to all who approach. It possesses all the knowledge of the stone from which it was carved and will exist as a timeless feature of the landscape.

SWM

Swarm

Scout Beetles

Range: 30 m Effect: You summon three fist-sized, docile beetles from the ground. For one hour, you can mentally see through the eyes of one beetle at a time. The beetles can crawl on any surface and obey simple directional commands.

Chitinous Veil

area: 5 m diameter Range: 20 m Effect: A dense, swirling cloud of non-biting gnats and moths appears. The cloud heavily obscures vision and muffles sound within it. The cloud persists for one minute.

Wall of Crawlers

Area: 10m long, 2m high, 0.5m thick Effect: A tangible, writhing wall of spiders, beetles, and centipedes rises from the ground. Passing through it is difficult, as the creatures cling and crawl over any who attempt it, impeding their movement. The wall lasts for ten minutes.

Devouring Carpet

Range: Touch area: 5 m radius Effect: You touch a point on the ground. A carpet of termites and woodlice spreads out from that point, rapidly consuming all non-living, non-magical wood and plant fiber in the area. A wooden floor becomes dust in one minute. The swarm disperses after its work is done.

Wasp Bombardment

Range: 60 m Effect: You conjure and hurl a pulsating, nest-like sac. It explodes on impact, releasing a furious cloud of large wasps in a 10-meter radius. The wasps attack any moving creature in the area for one minute, their stings causing sharp, burning pain and swelling.

Form of the Swarm

Range: Self Effect: For ten minutes, your physical body dissolves into a flying swarm of biting insects that occupies a 3-meter diameter cloud. In this form, you can pass through small cracks and openings. You can envelop a creature, and the thousands of bites cause intense, distracting pain.

Plague of Locusts

area: 1 km radius Effect: The sky darkens as a massive cloud of locusts descends upon the designated area. The swarm persists for one hour, devouring all non-magical vegetation, stripping trees bare, consuming crops, and leaving the landscape barren.

Hivemind Dominion

area: 500 m radius Effect: You extend your consciousness, seizing control of all natural insectoid and verminous creatures within the area. For one hour, you can command this vast, composite swarm as a single entity, directing its movements and actions with a thought. This does not grant you control over magically summoned creatures.

Genesis of the Chittering Spire

area: 5 km radius Effect: You permanently become a living, breathing hive-nexus at the center of the area. The ground for kilometers around is transformed into waxy, chitinous terrain, and all natural life is slowly repurposed into a single, interconnected hive organism. At the center, your body becomes a new, permanent, 100-meter tall spire of living chitin from which new swarm-creatures are birthed.

GRA

Gravity

Subtle Weight

Range: Touch Effect: One object no larger than a backpack that you touch feels twice as heavy for one minute. This makes it more cumbersome to lift and carry.

Upwelling Force

Area: 3 m diameter Range: 20 m Effect: Within a 3-meter diameter sphere you choose, the local gravitational pull is halved for one minute. Creatures inside feel unnaturally light, able to leap twice their normal height and land with feather-like softness. Loose, low-density materials like dust or leaves are stirred into the air by the slightest breeze, and liquids form high, slow-motion splashes.

Wall of Heavy Air

Area: 10m long, 3m high, 1m thick Effect: A transparent, shimmering curtain of distorted air forms. Passing through it feels like pushing against an immense, invisible weight, requiring great physical effort. Loose objects that enter the wall are pulled directly to the ground. The wall lasts for ten minutes.

Positional Lock

Range: 30 m Effect: You choose one object no larger than a horse. It becomes fixed in its exact spatial coordinates, subject to an immense gravitational force from all directions. It is utterly immovable by non-magical means for one hour.

Crushing Downforce

Area: 5 m radius sphere Range: 60 m Effect: A sphere of intensely focused gravity manifests at a point you choose. Within this sphere, for ten seconds, all objects are subjected to ten times the normal pull of the earth. Creatures are pinned to the ground, their bones groaning under the unbearable load. Branches snap from trees, and unsupported structures like arches and roofs buckle and collapse under their own immense new weight.

Form of the Comet

Range: Self Effect: For one minute, your body becomes a dense, stone-like core surrounded by a shimmering aura of kinetic energy. You are unaffected by normal gravitational forces, allowing for controlled flight. Your impacts can shatter stone walls.

Reverse Polarity

Area: 200 m radius Effect: You touch the ground, and for one minute, the direction of gravity is completely reversed within the area. Unsecured objects, water, and creatures are flung skyward at a constant acceleration.

Singularity Arrow

Range: 500 m Effect: You create a tiny, arrow-like distortion of spacetime and launch it at a point. Upon arrival, it creates a point of extreme gravity for a single second. All non-magical matter in a 3-meter radius around the point is violently compressed into a single, marble-sized, super-dense pellet.

Localized Event Horizon

Area: 10 m radius Range: 100 m Effect: You tear a permanent wound in the fabric of space, creating a 10-meter radius sphere of absolute blackness at a point you choose. Anything that crosses the sphere's event horizon is irrevocably drawn in and unmade. The sphere slowly pulls in nearby matter over centuries, permanently altering the landscape.

SLE

Sleep

Hush

Range: 10 m Effect: A single creature you can see feels a sudden wave of peaceful drowsiness. Their eyelids feel heavy, and their thoughts become placid and slow for one minute.

Slumber Dart

Range: 20 m Effect: A shimmering, intangible dart of silver light flies from your hand to a target. Upon contact, the target falls into a light, dreamless sleep for up to ten minutes, or until woken by a loud noise or being physically disturbed.

Wall of Murmurs

Area: 10m long, 3m high, 1m thick Effect: A shimmering, translucent curtain of air filled with faint, soothing whispers appears. Creatures passing through it are overcome with a powerful urge to yawn and find a place to rest. The wall lasts for ten minutes.

Dream Weaving

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a sleeping creature. For the next hour, you can observe their dreams as an invisible presence and subtly alter the dream's narrative, introducing a single new element or idea.

Hypnotic Haze

Area: 10 m radius sphere Range: 50 m Effect: A cloud of shimmering, lavender-scented mist fills a sphere. Creatures within the mist find their minds clouded and are overcome by an irresistible lethargy, eventually succumbing to a deep sleep that lasts for one hour. The mist dissipates after one minute.

Oneiric Manifestation

Range: Touch Effect: You touch a sleeping creature and reach into their dream. You pull a single, non-magical, inanimate object from it into the real world. The object is tangible but fades into mist after one hour. The dreamer's memory of the object in their dream becomes vague.

Waking Nightmare

Area: 100 m radius Effect: You touch the ground, and a wave of psychic energy spreads out. For one hour, creatures within the area perceive their surroundings through a lens of their deepest fears. Shadows twist into menacing shapes, and familiar faces appear subtly monstrous.

Shared Somnolence

Area: 500 m radius Effect: All creatures within a vast area fall into a deep, magical slumber. Their minds are drawn into a single, shared dreamscape that you can shape and control. The slumber lasts for eight hours, and upon waking, the dream feels real and profoundly significant to all who shared it.

Eternal Dream of the World

Area: 10 km radius Effect: You perform a ten-minute ritual that plunges an entire region into a perpetual state between waking and dreaming. The sky takes on a permanent twilight hue, the landscape becomes soft and surreal, and physical laws are subject to the collective unconscious of the inhabitants. The effect is permanent.

lorebooks.creator: Atemeles

1.name: Fire
1.content:
Make kindle:
Range: 1 m
Effect: A tiny, warm flame, no larger than a candle's, ignites on a point you can see. It persists for one hour or until extinguished. It produces no smoke or soot.

2.name: Fire
2.content:
Firewhip:
Range: 3 m
Effect: A whip-like tendril of fire extends from your hand. On contact with an object, it leaves a searing black mark. The whip lasts for one minute or until you release it.

3.name: Fire
3.content:
Wall of Embers:
Area: 10m long, 3m high, 0.5m thick
Effect: A shimmering, opaque curtain of swirling hot embers and smoke rises from the ground. The curtain radiates intense heat outward to a distance of 1 meter.

4.name: Fire
4.content:
Heat Sink:
Range: 20 m
Effect: All ambient heat within a 20-meter radius is rapidly drawn to a single, non-living object of your choice within that area. The surroundings become unnaturally cold, while the target object glows white-hot for one minute.

5.name: Fire
5.content:
Combustion Sphere:
Range: 50 m
Effect: A fist-sized bead of compressed fire flies from your hand to a point you choose. Upon arrival, it erupts into a 5-meter diameter sphere of roaring flame that scorches all surfaces within before dissipating.

6.name: Fire
6.content:
Salamander Form:
Range: Self
Effect: Your body and worn equipment are transformed into a single entity of living, sentient flame for ten minutes. You can move through spaces as small as 2 centimeters wide and are unharmed by non-magical fire. Physical objects you touch are superheated and may ignite.

7.name: Fire
7.content:
Volcanic Plume:
Area: 10m diameter, 100m high
Effect: The ground trembles and a massive column of fire, molten rock, and black ash erupts skyward from a point on the ground. The eruption continues for one minute, covering the area in a layer of hot ash.

8.name: Fire
8.content:
Solar Flare:
Range: 200 m
Effect: A brilliant, sun-hot beam of fire, 2 meters in diameter, descends vertically from the sky to a point you designate. The beam persists for five seconds, melting stone and vaporizing water on contact.

9.name: Fire
9.content:
Phoenix Immolation:
Area: 1000 m diameter
Effect: Your body becomes a locus of unbearable energy before detonating in a blinding flash. A wave of white-hot fire expands outward, reducing everything to ash within a 1000-meter diameter. After 24 hours, your body reforms from the central ashes, fully restored.

10.name: Water
10.content:
Create Spring:
Range: Touch
Effect: One liter of pure, cool, drinkable water appears within an open container you are touching.
