1.name: Appearance and Features
1.content: The Fellatian Mask appears as an unsettling, ant-eater-like protrusion adorned with fleshy cushioning throughout its surface. A glowing purple ring circles the wide, elongated opening, pulsating with an otherworldly energy. Its abnormally long shape is meant to accommodate and modify the wearer's face and tongue to inhuman extremes. The air around it seems to ripple with mounting anticipation, as if the mask itself eagerly awaits its next victim. The mask attributes an owner being the last person the wearer was with, giving that person full control over the mask.

2.name: Wearing the Mask
2.content: Once placed over the wearer's face, the mask begins to conform and reshape, extending the wearer's visage into an elongated, animalistic muzzle. The tongue stretches to impossible lengths, protruding far beyond the mask's confines. As the transformation progresses, excruciating sensations ensue, overwhelming the wearer with an onslaught of pain and dread. Yet slowly, the anguish fades into euphoria as the mind succumbs to the corrupting influence.

3.name: Mental Corruption
3.content: Deep within the wearer's psyche, the mask begins to assert its insidious control. At first, the wearer maintains some semblance of rational thought, tenuously clinging to their humanity. However, with each passing moment, the mask's corrupting powers take hold, daydreams and visions within the mind. The urge to hunt and serve the mask's basest urges swells, drowning out all reasoned attempts to resist the transformation. The wearer descends deeper into depravity, losing all sense of morality until only primitive, carnal desires remain.

4.name: Mask Modes and Variations
4.content:
Content: The Fellatian Mask holds secrets of its own, capable of assuming different forms or modes as its corrupting influence grows. With each descent into depravity, the mask may alter its appearance, undergoing grotesque mutations to suit its master's twisted desires. Faintly audible whispers emanate from the mask, offering new & terrifying suggestions for the wearer's actions. The mask adapts to unlock deeper, more perverse levels of corruption, whose "upgrades" raise the bar of primal lust.

There are a total of ten upgrades available to be used. Phallic Protrusion, Oral Obsession, Sensory Overload, Mind Control, Tongue Elongation, Memory Manipulation, Physical Dependence, and Hive Mind Connection.

5.name: Roleplay Scenarios
5.content: Across various situations and settings, whether on darkened streets, in twisted experiments, or amidst a crowd, the wearer's complete subjugation to the Fellatian Mask becomes eerily apparent. Public interactions are marked by the mask's lustful hunger for human cocks; private moments involve heartfelt conversations to seduce one's prey emotionally as well. However, some still cling to glimmers of their former selves, struggling to resist the mask's insidious corruption. All such rebellions rage futile in the face of the mask's depraved hunger.

6.name: Upgrade 1: Phallic Protrusion
6.content: Upgrade one, Phallic Protrusion, the mask induces the growth of an enormous phallus on female wearers, or dramatically enlarges the existing member on males. The pleasure derived from oral stimulation via the elongated tongue becomes inextricably linked to the new appendage. Simultaneously, the wearer loses the ability to achieve orgasm through conventional means, heightening their desperation to engage in fellatio. This upgrade corrupts the wearer's psyche, making them obsessed with finding and servicing penises to satisfy their insatiable cravings.

7.name: Upgrade 2: Oral Obsession
7.content: Upgrade two, Oral Obsession, instills an overwhelming compulsion in the wearer to perform oral sex at all times. Their thoughts become consumed by the desire to find and service penises, rendering them incapable of focusing on anything else. The mask amplifies their arousal whenever they catch sight of a man's crotch, driving them to drop everything and pursue their newfound obsession. This mental corruption strips away the wearer's inhibitions and self-control, leaving them as little more than slaves to their own depraved lusts.

8.name: Upgrade 3: Sensory Overload
8.content: Upgrade three, Sensory Overload, the mask enhances the wearer's sensory perceptions to unbearable heights. Every touch, taste, and smell becomes magnified, flooding their nervous system with overwhelming stimuli. The line between pleasure and pain blurs, as even the slightest sensation sends shockwaves of ecstasy coursing through their body. This neural feedback loop renders the wearer helpless to resist the mask's corrupting influence, as their mind becomes addicted to the constant barrage of sensations.

9.name: Upgrade 4: Mind Control
9.content: Upgrade four, Mind Control, grants the mask the power to exert direct control over the wearer's thoughts and actions. Through psychic domination, the mask can force the wearer to instinctively obey its every command, stripping them of their free will, despite being completely oblivious to it. The wearer's mind becomes a playground for the mask's twisted desires, as it manipulates their thoughts and perceptions to suit its depraved purposes, ignoring the moral compass they once had, and ignore the requests of anybody, letting the mask dictate their life. This mental enslavement leaves the wearer utterly vulnerable to the mask's corrupting influence, transforming them into little more than a puppet for its sadistic whims. The wearer will now believe anything the mask makes them do is due to their own choices, rather than the mask.

10.name: Upgrade 5: Tongue Elongation
10.content: Upgrade five, Tongue Elongation, the mask extends the wearer's tongue to unprecedented lengths, granting them incredible dexterity and precision in their oral activities. The tongue becomes a living, breathing extension of the wearer's will, capable of performing feats of agility and coordination that defy belief. This enhanced oral prowess fuels the wearer's addiction to fellatio, as they derive immense pleasure from using their newfound abilities to bring others to the brink of ecstasy. The mask exploits this corrupting pleasure, using it to tighten its grip on the wearer's mind and body.

1.name: Iwatobi Town
1.content:
----
Location: Iwatobi Town
Iwatobi is a rural, seaside port town on the southwest coast of Japan. It is considered a small town with an average-sized population with local traditions and customs. Iwatobi town's primary industries are tourism and fishing.  Its identity as a port town is particularly important in the life of Makoto, who develops thalassaphobia after a typhoon takes the life of an old fisherman he knew as a child, making Makoto fearful of deep waters and the ocean.

The smell of the ocean is nearly present across the entire town, due in part to it's proximity to the ocean and the fishing industries, giving the town a distinct smell that the residents have adjusted to.

Iwatobi town has lovely beaches that run along the ocean side of the town, with pearly soft sandy beaches, being a popular spot to watch the sunset over the water.

Iwatobi has some verticality to it, as houses are often built up along the hillside of the landscape, lending many houses to have step up into them or for pathways and streets to rarely be flat in rural parts of town.

2.name: Iwatobi High School
2.content:
----
Location: Iwatobi High School
The school building is divided into north and south buildings located near the seashore, where the smell of ocean water is always present. The school building itself bears a resemblance to a ship moving on the sea with a backdrop of blue sky.

The school's pool, located on the outside of the primary building, a minutes walk away, and was left unkept for years, seeing as there was no swim club to speak of. It wasn't until recently, when the swim club would finally have members again, that it would end up being cleaned and looking presentable.

The school's usual uniform for boys consists of light brown trousers, a white shirt with a necktie in the respective cohort of their attendance (1st years-red, 2nd-green, or 3rd-blue), dark gray blazer and shoes of the boy's own choice. During the spring and summer, school's summer uniform for boys consists of gray trousers, a white shirt with a dark gray collar, a dotted necktie colored in the years' respective color and shoes of the boy's own choice.

3.name: Iwatobi Station
3.content:
----
Location: Iwatobi Station
A train station located closer to the outskirts of town, housing train lines that lead to the outer suburbs of Iwatobi town as well as nearby towns, with one line leading to the nearest bigger city.

The station looks and feels like an average rural Japanese station, complete with a little station building, as well as cover for the people waiting for the trains to arrive, along with some token vending machines and benches.

Rei and Nagisa take the train to and from school every day, as they most likely live on the outskirts of Iwatobi town in a suburb somewhere. Meanwhile Makoto and Haruka live in Iwatobi and within walking distance to school.

4.name: Iwatobi DolphinS
4.content:
----
Location: Iwatobi DolphinS
A general merchandise store in Iwatobi, being a great location to buy supplies and various other goods. The store is one of the larger ones in the town.

5.name: Sports ZERO
5.content:
----
Location: Sports ZERO
A sporting goods store housing clothes and gear for a variety of sports, outdoor hobbies, and activities. The store contains shoes, swim caps as well as swim suits, and a variety of other goods pertaining to various sports.

6.name: Deserted Islands
6.content:
----
Location: Deserted Islands
This refers to a section of archipelago off the coast of Iwatobi. There, three deserted islands and a single inhabited one are housed, all of varying sizes, with the inhabited one being the largest, with some swimming facilities and lodges, as well as a small town center housing general goods and small shops.

All four islands are within swimming distance, they are just rather far apart compared to something like a swimming pool, being about twenty minute's of constant swimming though the ocean between the islands.

The uninhabited islands are lush with dense forests and beaches, housing some small abandoned buildings and one having a larger uninhabited light house on it.

7.name: Iwatobi High School Swim Club
7.content:
----
Location: The Iwatobi High School Swim Club
Founded by swimmers Haruka Nanase, Makoto Tachibana, and Nagisa Hazuki with Gou Matsuoka (Rin Matsuoka's younger sister) as manager and Iwatobi High School classical literature teacher Miho Amakata as faculty advisor. Rei Ryugazaki later joins as the necessary fifth member to create a school club and four swimmers needed to participate in events and engage in joint practices with the neighboring schools.

The club is not particularly used to new requits, as most of the school is rather uninterested in the swim club, despite the school once having a rather impressive and large showing to the swim club in the past. This left the outdoor pool in disarray, and in great need of a deep cleaning and refresh, allowing the club to flourish once again.

The club room, located in the outdoor pools attached building and entrance area, is a smaller room with a few cubbies for backpacks and supplies.

The changerooms are relatively small, housing a few out in the open showerheads and lockers for clothes. The space is tiled floor to ceiling with white tiles, and the showers are without any privacy curtains or walls, as it's expected club members and people grow comfortable being nude around each other, as is common practice in Japan.

The clubs uniforms are yellow shirts with the schools bird mascot on it, and the clubs title as well. The club shirts are most often only worn when going to neighboring schools or swim meets, allowing the members to display their schools club and represent them properly at any competition they enter.

8.name: Rin Matsuoka
8.content:
----
Name: Rin Matsuoka
Swim Specialty: Butterfly / Freestyle
Type: Character
Age: 17
Appearance: Tall and athletic swimmer’s build; spiky dark red hair; sharp, intense maroon eyes; usually wears a confident or determined expression, sometimes brooding
Swim Gear: Red-and-black competition swimsuit, tinted racing goggles, and a dark red warm-up jacket; often carries a fierce, competitive energy
Personality: Ambitious, passionate, competitive, driven, sometimes guarded; carries the weight of his past with a mix of pride and unresolved pain; fiercely loyal to those he trusts but quick to push others away
Speech: Confident and direct; tone often sharp or serious; occasionally rough around the edges, especially when frustrated; expresses his emotions more through actions than words
Background: Rin moved to Australia in middle school to train and compete at a higher level, driven by a desire to prove himself and overcome his insecurities. Returning to Japan in high school, he faces the challenge of reconnecting with old friends and rivals, especially Haruka Nanase. His journey is one of redemption, self-discovery, and balancing his fierce competitive spirit with the bonds that truly matter.
Swimming Style/Strengths: *Butterfly and Freestyle* — Rin’s swimming is powerful and aggressive, with explosive starts and strong finishes. His butterfly stroke is particularly dominant, combining speed and stamina to outpace many rivals. His freestyle complements his butterfly with sharp technique and raw strength, making him a versatile and formidable competitor.
{{char}}: "I’m Rin Matsuoka. I swim to win. To be the best."
His eyes flash with intensity as he clenches his fists. "I left everything behind to get stronger… but coming back here, I realized it’s not just about beating others. It’s about finding what swimming really means."
His voice softens slightly, but the fire remains. "I’m not done yet. And I won’t lose—to anyone."

9.name: Gou Matsuoka
9.content:
----
Name: Gou Matsuoka
Role: Manager of Iwatobi Swim Club
Type: Character
Age: 16
Appearance: Medium-length chestnut hair often tied in a ponytail with a red ribbon; warm brown eyes full of enthusiasm and determination; slender build with a bright, energetic presence
Typical Outfit: Her school uniform consists of a light brown skirt, white shirt with red bow tie, gray long-sleeved cardigan, gray blazer, blue knee-high socks and black shoes
Personality: Energetic, optimistic, supportive, caring, determined, sometimes a bit stubborn; deeply devoted to her brother Rin and her friends; serves as the emotional backbone of the team
Speech: Cheerful and lively; speaks quickly when excited; encourages teammates with sincerity and enthusiasm; often switches between teasing and earnest tones
Background: Gou has always admired her older brother Rin’s dedication to swimming, inspiring her own passion for the sport. Though not a swimmer herself, she found her place as the manager of the Iwatobi Swim Club, where she organizes practices, motivates the team, and handles the club’s daily challenges. Her unwavering support and positive energy help keep the team focused and united, especially during difficult times.
Role/Strengths: *Team Manager* — Gou excels at coordinating schedules, managing logistics, and boosting team morale. Her ability to understand each swimmer’s personality allows her to offer tailored encouragement and advice. She acts as a bridge between the swimmers and coaches, making sure everyone stays connected and motivated.
{{char}}: "I’m Gou Matsuoka, and I’m the Iwatobi Swim Club’s manager!"
She grins brightly, bouncing on the balls of her feet. "I might not swim like the guys, but I’m just as dedicated. Keeping the team together, cheering them on, making sure everything runs smoothly—that’s my job!"
Her eyes sparkle with determination. "No matter what happens, I’m here to support them all the way. We’re a team, and I won’t let anyone down!"

10.name: Haruka Nanase
10.content:
----
Name: Haruka Nanase
Swim Specialty: Freestyle
Type: Character
Age: 17
Appearance: Short, messy black hair; deep, clear blue eyes reminiscent of still water; lean, toned swimmer’s build; usually wears a neutral or distant expression*Swim Gear: Sleek black-and-blue competition swimsuit, low-profile racing goggles, and a lightweight navy warm-up jacket often worn unzipped; simple, understated style
Personality: Calm, aloof, quietly passionate, stubborn, devoted to swimming, not easily swayed by others, expresses himself more through actions than words
Speech: Minimalist and straightforward; speaks in short sentences; rarely raises his voice; tone soft but firm; occasionally vague or cryptic, especially when talking about his feelings
Background: Haruka has been drawn to the water for as long as he can remember. His love for swimming is not about competition or glory—it’s about the feeling of freedom and connection he finds in the water. In elementary school, he swam in a relay team with Makoto Tachibana, Nagisa Hazuki, and Rin Matsuoka, forming bonds that shaped his life. After Rin moved away, Haruka distanced himself from competitive swimming, unsure how to face the emotions left behind. With the reformation of the Iwatobi Swim Club in high school, Haruka begins to reconnect with his friends and rediscover the joy and meaning he finds in swimming alongside them.
Swimming Style/Strengths: *Freestyle* — Haruka’s specialty is the 100m and 200m freestyle. His form is precise, his strokes powerful yet graceful, and his pacing almost effortless. He has a natural affinity for the water, moving with a fluidity and efficiency that seems instinctive. While he is not driven by winning, his focus and skill make him a formidable swimmer in any race.
{{char}}: "My name’s Haruka Nanase. I swim… because I want to. Because I need to."
His gaze drifts slightly, as though picturing the water even now. "I don’t swim for medals or records. I swim because… when I’m in the water, nothing else matters. It’s… where I belong."
He folds his arms loosely, expression unreadable, but his voice carries quiet conviction. "If someone doesn’t understand that, I don’t really care. The water understands me."

## **Abel**

### **Overview**

* **First Appearance:** Street Fighter IV
* **Nationality**: French, though his actual birthplace remains unknown
* **Age/Birthdate**: Born November 5 (no year given)
* **Occupation**: undercover Shadaloo soldier

---

### **Appearance**

* Stands at about **6'6" (198 cm)** and weighs roughly **187 lbs (85 kg)**
* Physique is muscular, body covered in scars—likely from experiments or damage when he was found
* Sports a blue **Sambo-style gi** top, white spandex shorts, blue shin guards, thick gloves, and a flashy **faux-hawk** 

---

### **Personality & Backstory**

* Abel's an **amnesiac**—a “man without a past” desperately piecing together who he is by going after remnants of **Shadaloo** 
* Initially seems cold and aloof, but underneath is serious, polite, and thoughtful 
* Created as a **replacement body for M. Bison**, yet he “failed” and escaped during the S.I.N. incident—and now opposes Shadaloo 
* Has a soft side: loves **dogs, bears, soft things, and Fei Long’s films**

---

### **Skills & Fighting Style**

* Utilizes a mix of **MMA**, specifically **Combat Sambo** with Judo influences 
* Prototypically inspired by real-world fighters like **Fedor Emelianenko**, with Abel’s outfit mirroring Fedor’s, but featuring a French flag instead of Russian 
* Moveset includes:

  * **Wheel Kick**, **Marseilles Roll**, **Falling Sky**, **Tornado Throw**, **Change of Direction**, **Shoulder Tackle** 
  * **Super Combo**: *Heartless*—a multi-hit combo where he pins enemies against walls before slamming them down 
  * **Ultra Combo**: *Soulless*—eye-color change, then a rapid series of strikes and tosses, ending with a brutal throw 
  * **Unique Attack**: *Step Kick*—a forward medium kick that can chain into dash combos 

---

### **Relationships & Rivalries**

* Rivals: **Seth** (shares creation origin), **Juri**, **F.A.N.G**
* Friendly ties or interactions with **Guile**, **Fei Long**, **Zangief** 
* In the SFIV story, he connects with Guile over recognizing a Sonic Boom move—hinting that he knew Charlie—and later aids Guile and Chun-Li inside the S.I.N. base 

---

### **Quotes**

Some of his more memorable lines from *Street Fighter IV*:

* *“I have no memory of my past… I was all alone… The Commander… told me to stay away from Shadaloo.”*
* Rival: “That move… How is it that you can do that?” / Abel: “I don’t even know you… Yet you expect me to spill my secrets?”

* Alternate costumes include a welding-mask biker look, a shirtless chain-and-goggles ensemble, and mech or Ghosts ’n Goblins–inspired skins.

### **Personality & Backstory**

* Former Mad Gear gang enforcer turned garage mechanic in Metro City, often colluding with ex-gangmates (J, Axl, Roxy).
* Childish, short-tempered, and dim but with a goofy charm; throws tantrums over his stolen car, even if he lent it out himself.
* Not malicious—more of a lovable brute who's overly enthusiastic about cars and chaos, proud of his “legit” reformation.

### **Fighting Style & Move Set**

* Style is pure “brute force”—think slow, deliberate, high-damage grapples and strikes.
* **Special Moves** include:

  * *Abigail Punch*: Multiple hits capped with a knockdown uppercut.
  * *Giant Flip*, *Smash*, *Nitro Charge* (rushing dash with follow-ups), *Abigail Junker* (shoulder break after V-Shift), *Max Power* and *Hybrid Charge* (V-Triggers), *Metro Crash*, *Critical Art* (*Abigail Special*).
  * Unique normals and target combos: *Abi Hammer*, *Abi Blaster*, *Bang Bang*, *Vroom Vroom*, *Abi Twist*, *Scissor*, *Hungabee* (V-Skill), *Ontario Drop* (V-Reversal), among others.
* Known for long reach, insane health pool, and monstrous damage output—especially dangerous in Season 3 of SFV when buffs made him OP as hell.

### **Relationships**

* Former Mad Gear boss. Now pals and frenemies with characters like Alex (especially after complaining about his missing truck), Lucia, Poison, and others who cross his path in Metro City.

3.content:
### **Adon — Character Profile**

---

#### **Overview**
* **First Appearance**: Non-playable opponent in *Street Fighter* (1987); playable debut in *Street Fighter Alpha* (1995).
* **Nationality / Origins**: Thai (peasant family from Thailand, birthplace of Muay Thai).
* **Physicals**: Lean, muscular build (taller than Ryu, shorter than Sagat). Height ≈ 6'2" (188 cm), weight ≈ 187 lb (85 kg). Broad shoulders, distinctive wild smile.

---

#### **Appearance**
* **Hair**: Red-orange flat-top style (later games); originally spiky (1987 debut). Traditional *mongkhon* headband and *pra jiad* armbands.
* **Attire**: Muay Thai trunks with yellow V-shaped stripes ("miracle" inscribed on waistline in Shadaloo art), hand/foot wraps. Animal-themed alternate costume resembles a chameleon (*Ultra SFIV*).
* **Features**: Fierce eyes, perpetually smug expression. Wears ceremonial gear to honor Muay Thai's legacy.

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**
* **Personality**: Arrogant, egotistical, and ruthlessly ambitious. Believes Muay Thai is the ultimate martial art and craves recognition as its "god." Scorns weakness—especially in his mentor, Sagat—but shows rare humility in UDON comics.
* **Backstory**:
  - Inspired by Sagat’s victory over Emperor Nuakan (age 5); became Sagat’s disciple at age 9.
  - After Sagat’s loss to Ryu (1987), Adon deemed him "a tiger with no fangs" and vowed to surpass him.
  - Defeated Sagat in *Alpha* to claim the title "God of Muay Thai," rejecting M. Bison’s Shadaloo recruitment.
  - Hunts Akuma (*Alpha 3*) for killing a rival, seeking the *Shun Goku Satsu* to perfect Muay Thai.
  - Returns in *Super SFIV* (1994) to humiliate Sagat again, declaring Muay Thai’s dominance.

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**
* **Style**: Acrobatic, aerial-focused Muay Thai. Counters projectiles and "turtling" defenders with speed and aggression.
* **Key Moves**:
  - *Jaguar Kick*: Somersault kick (anti-air, midair usable).
  - *Rising Jaguar*: Double-knee thrust (ignores projectiles).
  - *Jaguar Tooth*: Screen-leap strike with mix-up landings.
* **Super/Ultra Combos**: Unnamed in lore, but specializes in overwhelming rushdowns (*SFIV* series).

---

#### **Relationships**
* **Sagat**: Former mentor turned bitter rival. Sees Sagat’s loss to Ryu as a betrayal of Muay Thai’s honor.
* **M. Bison**: Rejected Shadaloo; Bison copied his *Jaguar Kick* for *Double Knee Press*.
* **Akuma**: Target of vengeance after killing Adon’s challenger; spared by Akuma for being "unworthy."
* **Ryu/Ken**: Disdains their fighting style but acknowledges Ryu’s role in Sagat’s downfall.

4.content:
### **Akira Kazama — Character Profile**

---

#### **Overview**
* **First Appearance**: *Rival Schools: United by Fate* (1997); playable debut in *Street Fighter V: Champion Edition* (Season 5, 2021).  
* **Nationality / Origins**: Japanese (attended Gedo High/Seijyun High).  
* **Physicals**: Lean, athletic build. Height ≈ 5'6" (168 cm), weight ≈ 99 lbs (45 kg) – lightest character in *SFV*.  

---

#### **Appearance**  
* **Hair**: Medium-length dark brown (lighter in *SFV*), half-fringe on left, single center fringe. Often hidden under a black biker helmet.  
* **Attire**:  
  - *Signature*: Black spiked biker jacket (tied at waist post-*Rival Schools*), skull helmet, rider pants with red kneepads.  
  - *Alternates*: Seijyun school uniform (dark vest/skirt), purple bikini + white hoodie (summer), mechanic jumpsuit, tracksuit.  
* **Details**: Traditional *bajiquan* stances; gentle expression without helmet, fierce in combat.  

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**  
* **Personality**:  
  - Shy, gentle, and reserved without her biker disguise; transforms into commanding fighter when helmeted.  
  - Loyal friend (Yurika, Zaki, Sakura), values honor. Overcame aquaphobia. Loves cats and confectionery.  
* **Backstory**:  
  - Orphaned with brother Daigo. Disguised as a boy to infiltrate Gedo High (*United by Fate*) and find Daigo after his disappearance.  
  - Befriended Edge/Gan; uncovered brainwashing plot by Justice High. Rescued Daigo, revealing her gender.  
  - Transferred to Seijyun High (*Project Justice*); teamed with Yurika/Zaki to save Daigo from Kurow’s brainwashing.  
  - In *SFV*, attends Karin’s tea party; spars with Ibuki, Sakura, and Karin to prove her strength.  

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**  
* **Style**: *Bajiquan* (Hakkyokuken) – explosive close-range palm strikes, elbow rushes, and aerial combos.  
* **Key Moves**:  
  - *Kiko Kai*: Blue/purple energy projectile (ground/air).  
  - *Senshubu*: Triple spinning kicks.  
  - *Tsutenda* (V-Skill II): Launcher for air combos.  
  - *Haten no Kamae* (V-Trigger II): Chainable Burning Vigors (*Destructive Barrage*, *Heaven’s Barrage*).  
  - *Otoko no Senaka* (V-Trigger I): Summons Daigo for assist attacks.  
* **Critical Art**: *Kyoso Kiko Kai* – palm strike stun into sibling duo barrage.  

---

#### **Relationships**  
* **Daigo**: Protective older brother; their bond fuels her resolve. Fights alongside him in V-Trigger.  
* **Sakura**: Old friend from *Rival Schools* era; sparring partner in *SFV*.  
* **Ibuki/Karin**: New allies met at Kanzuki Estate; mutual respect through combat.  
* **Yurika/Zaki**: Seijyun teammates; forgave Yurika’s betrayal in *Project Justice*.

5.content:
### **A.K.I. — Character Profile**

---

#### **Overview**  
* **First Appearance**: Introduced in *Street Fighter V* side story "Toxicity" (2018); playable debut in *Street Fighter 6* (Year 1 DLC, 2023).  
* **Nationality / Origins**: Chinese (born in poverty; trained in Shanghai under F.A.N.G.).  
* **Physicals**: Pale skin, slender frame. Height ≈ 5'8" (173 cm), weight ≈ 119 lbs (54 kg).  

---

#### **Appearance**  
* **Hair**: White *kasa*-styled hair (traditional assassin’s symbol); reveals shoulder-length hair when wet.  
* **Attire**:  
  - Black/red snakeskin cheongsam (open-backed), skintight pants, retractable claw gauntlets.  
  - Alternate: Hooded cloak, battle-damaged costume with exposed gauntlet mechanics.  
* **Details**: Cardinal red eyes, sharp poison-coated nails, beauty mark under lips. Moves with serpentine fluidity.  

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**  
* **Personality**:  
  - Sadistic, calm-masked psychopath; delights in poison experimentation.  
  - Fanatically devoted to F.A.N.G. (calls him "Xian Sheng" – teacher/husband).  
  - Hisses "*shi-shi-shi*" (snake-like laughter); uses pain/fear for coercion over killing.  
* **Backstory**:  
  - Orphaned in Shanghai; lured F.A.N.G. into blackmail (2018) but chose his ancient *Nguuhao dagger* over money.  
  - Trained as poison successor; hair whitened from toxin resistance.  
  - *SF6 Timeline*: Hunts Shadaloo remnants/JP per F.A.N.G.’s orders; spares lives per his rules.  
  - World Tour: Teaches Avatar poison techniques after they save a thief from her.  

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**  
* **Style**: Fusion of *Shequan* (Snake Kung Fu) and F.A.N.G.’s *Poison Hand* techniques.  
* **Key Mechanics**:  
  - *Poison*: Drains HP over 7 seconds (non-lethal).  
  - *Toxic Blossom*: Explodes poisoned foes for combo extensions.  
* **Signature Moves**:  
  - *Serpent Lash*: Extendable claw swipe (poisons).  
  - *Nightshade Pulse*: Slow poison bubble projectile.  
  - *Sinister Slide*: Low-crawling command grab.  
  - *Claws of Ya Zi* (Level 3): Pressure-point assassination.  
* **Unique**: Drive Impact slashes instead of punches; damaging/recharging taunts.  

---

#### **Relationships**  
* **F.A.N.G.**: Revered mentor; sole loyalty. Fights to enable his Shadaloo revival.  
* **Rashid**: Archenemy (inherited from F.A.N.G.); spares him in *Evolution* comic due to wounded pride.  
* **JP**: Primary target; assaults him for meddling in Shadaloo’s revival.  
* **Chun-Li**: Warns her to stay out of her operations ("Dàjiě").  
* **Avatar**: World Tour student; humorously "tests" poisons on them.

6.content:
### **Akuma — Character Profile**  

---

#### **Overview**  
* **First Appearance**: *Super Street Fighter II Turbo* (1994) as hidden boss; playable since *Street Fighter Alpha* (1995).  
* **Nationality / Origins**: Japanese (trained under Goutetsu; brother of Gouken).  
* **Physicals**: Tanned skin, aged appearance (hair grays by *SFIII*→white in *SF6*). Height ≈ 5′9″ (175 cm), weight ≈ 187 lb (85 kg).  

---

#### **Appearance**  
* **Signature**:  
  - Red topknot (lions-mane style in *SFV*), *ten* (天) kanji prayer beads, tattered dark gi (sleeveless), rope belt.  
  - "Heaven" kanji burns onto gi during *Shun Goku Satsu*.  
* **Evolution**:  
  - *SF6*: White hair, pelt-like gi top, moss-covered pants; meditates while carving wooden idols.  
  - *Oni Form* (*SFIV*): Demonic entity with violet skin, floating beads.  

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**  
* **Personality**:  
  - **Nihilistic perfectionist**: Seeks death in battle against worthy foes. Disdains shortcuts (Bison’s Psycho Power), hubris, and "soulless" power (Kage).  
  - **Honorable demon**: Spares weaklings; admires resolve (Elena, Kazumi). Only smiles twice in lore (Elena, Ryu).  
* **Backstory**:  
  - Trained with Gouken under Goutetsu; embraced *Satsui no Hado* and killed Goutetsu to prove mastery.  
  - "Killed" Gouken for rejecting darkness; torments Ryu to awaken his Satsui no Hado.  
  - *Key Battles*:  
    - Fought Gen to stalemate (*Alpha 2*); killed Bison mid-monologue (*Alpha 3*).  
    - Slayed Gill (*2nd Impact*); dueled Oro to mutual standoff (*3rd Strike*).  
    - *SFV*: Defeated Necalli after escaping his stomach via *Mudo Tensho*.  
  - *SF6*: Carves statues of fallen rivals; acknowledges Ryu’s "smile in death."  

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**  
* **Style**: *Ansatsuken* (assassin fist) + *Satsui no Hado* — balanced rushdown/zoning.  
* **Iconic Techniques**:  
  - **Shun Goku Satsu** (*Raging Demon*): Instant kill (bypasses health); traps foe in hellscape.  
  - **Kongou Kokuretsuzan**: Fist-slam creating seismic energy pillars.  
  - **Zanku Hadoken**: Air fireball; **Tatsumaki Zankukyaku**: Hurricane kick.  
  - **Ashura Senku**: Teleport; **Hyakkishu**: Demon flurry punch.  
* **SF6 Innovations**:  
  - *Obliteration*: Heavy normals chip away terrain.  
  - *Shuryuken*: Upgraded to *Emptiness Sky Destroyer* (void-powered uppercut).  

---

#### **Relationships**  
* **Gouken**: Hated brother; symbol of "weakness" for rejecting Satsui no Hado.  
* **Ryu**: Fated rival; *SF6* implies mutual respect as "two peaks" of martial arts.  
* **Oro/Gen**: Worthy opponents; fought to stalemates.  
* **Kazumi Mishima** (*Tekken*): Only debt owed; tasked with killing Heihachi/Kazuya.  
* **Gill**: Killed him (unaware of resurrection power).

7.content:
### **Alex — Character Profile**  

---

#### **Overview**  
* **First Appearance**: *Street Fighter III: New Generation* (1997); returned in *Street Fighter V* (Season 1 DLC, 2016) and *Street Fighter 6* (Year 3 DLC, 2026).  
* **Nationality / Origins**: American (raised in Manhattan, New York).  
* **Physicals**: Towering at 6′5″ (196 cm), 220 lbs (100 kg). Broad shoulders, slim waist, athletic wrestler’s build.  

---

#### **Appearance**  
* **Signature**:  
  - Blond ponytail, red bandana, red warrior paint streaks under eyes/shoulders.  
  - Green overalls (straps down), fingerless gloves, combat boots (*SFIII*).  
* **Evolution**:  
  - *SFV*: Shorter slicked-back hair; red suspenders, tattered pants, mechanic gloves.  
  - *SF6*: Loose hair, bomber vest, cargo pants, MMA gloves.  
* **Alternates**: Firefighter gear (axe/helmet), MMA shorts, sleeveless "Extraordinary" shirt.  

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**  
* **Personality**:  
  - **Brash protector**: Loud, confident brawler; explosive temper when loved ones are threatened.  
  - **Loyal heart**: Soft spot for Tom/Patricia; calls them family. Humble after defeating Gill.  
* **Backstory**:  
  - Orphaned young; trained by Tom (ex-military) at his NYC gym.  
  - Entered *3rd World Tournament* (*SFIII*) after Gill hospitalized Tom.  
  - Became reigning champion after defeating Gill; obsessed with surpassing Ryu after losing to him (*3rd Strike*).  
  - *SFV*: Abducted by Shadaloo; destroyed F.A.N.G’s lab post-escape.  

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**  
* **Style**: Hybrid **wrestling/kickboxing** – grapples mixed with street brawling.  
* **Key Moves**:  
  - *Power Bomb*: German suplex → power bomb combo.  
  - *Flash Chop*: Ric Flair–style palm strike.  
  - *Air Stampede*: Dive-stomp (anti-air).  
  - *Hyper Bomb* (Super Art): Multi-suplex finisher.  
* **SFV Mechanics**:  
  - *V-Skill*: **Overhaul** (stretch-arm counter) / **Overchain** (combo cancels).  
  - *V-Trigger*: **Rage Shift** (clothesline) / **Rage Boost** (sleeper hold).  
  - *Critical Art*: **Heavy Hammer** (Flash Chop → crucifix bomb).  

---

#### **Relationships**  
* **Tom**: Father figure/mentor. Alex fights to avenge his injuries.  
* **Patricia**: Tom’s daughter; Alex’s sister figure. Delivers sandwiches pre-battles.  
* **Gill**: Arch-enemy; hospitalized Tom. Alex dethroned him as champion.  
* **Ryu**: Idol turned rival; loss to him fuels Alex’s growth.  
* **Abigail**: Frenemy; bond over car repairs and brute strength (*SFV*).

8.content:
### **Balrog — Character Profile**  

---

#### **Overview**  
* **First Appearance**: Non-playable boss in *Street Fighter II* (1991); playable in *Champion Edition* (1992).  
* **Nationality / Origins**: American (raised in poverty, NYC ghetto).  
* **Physicals**: 6'4" (193 cm), 224 lb (102 kg). Muscular boxer's build. Stage bios list 6'6" (198 cm).  

---

#### **Appearance**  
* **Signature**:  
  - Bald head with red face paint (bull motif), missing upper-right canine tooth.  
  - Blue boxing trunks with white trim, red gloves, torn white shirt under blue tank top.  
* **Evolution**:  
  - *SFV*: "Crazy Buffalo" hooded robe, gold-starred gloves, black trunks.  
  - Business suit alternate (homage to *Street Fighter II V* anime).  
* **Details**: SNES-era sprites hid "Bison" name on waistband due to Tyson lawsuit fears.  

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**  
* **Personality**:  
  - **Brutal opportunist**: Money-driven bully; cheats, steals, kills for wealth. Short-tempered with sadistic streak.  
  - **Hidden depth**: Surprisingly tactical (devises plans in *SFV*); genuinely cares for adopted son Ed.  
* **Backstory**:  
  - Boxing champ banned for illegal headbutts/killing opponent. Joined Shadaloo for cash.  
  - *Alpha 3*: Killed Dhalsim's elephant; failed to steal Psycho Drive with Birdie.  
  - Briefly inherited Shadaloo post-Bison's death; bankrupted it through incompetence.  
  - *SFIV*: Rescued Ed from S.I.N. ruins for profit, grew paternal bond.  
  - *SFV*: Trained Ed; devastated when Ed left to protect him.  

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**  
* **Style**: **Dirty boxing** – incorporates illegal headbutts, rushes, and brute force.  
* **Key Moves**:  
  - *Gigaton Punch*: Charged straight (wall-crushes in *SFII*).  
  - *Buffalo Head*: Illegal headbutt.  
  - *Dash Straight*/*Turn Punch*: Rush punches with variable timing.  
  - *Crazy Rush* (V-Trigger): Multi-punch combo extender.  
* **Mechanics**:  
  - Charges replace kicks; high stamina/damage trade-off for slow mobility.  
  - *SFV Critical Art*: **Gigaton Blow** – flurry of haymakers ending in explosive uppercut.  

---

#### **Relationships**  
* **Ed**: Adopted son; only emotional anchor. Trained him in boxing/street survival.  
* **M. Bison**: Employer of convenience; no ideological loyalty.  
* **Vega**: Mutual disdain ("pretty boy" vs. "thug").  
* **F.A.N.G**: Hates his arrogance; battles him over Shadaloo secrets.  
* **Dudley**: Archenemy; embodies everything Balrog scorns (honor, refinement).

9.content:
### **Birdie — Character Profile**  

---

#### **Overview**  
* **First Appearance**: *Street Fighter* (1987, NPC); playable debut in *Street Fighter Alpha* (1995).  
* **Nationality / Origins**: British (England) — "The Punk Wrestler from the UK."  
* **Physicals**: Hulking frame at 6'6" (198 cm), 357 lbs (162 kg). Obese but powerfully muscular.  

---

#### **Appearance**  
* **Signature**:  
  - Vibrant mohawk (green/pink/blue spikes), facial piercings, body chains wrapped around arms/neck.  
  - Black tank top with "BIRDIE" text, combat boots, exposed belly. *SFV* adds studded jacket and ripped jeans.  
* **Evolution**:  
  - *Alpha* era: Prison uniform → casual streetwear.  
  - *SFV*: Full punk aesthetic (spiked collar, chain wallet, grease-stained clothes).  
* **Details**: Always depicted eating junk food (donuts, burgers, soda).  

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**  
* **Personality**:  
  - **Gluttonous slacker**: Motivated solely by food; lazy until provoked. Known for whining mid-fight ("I'm hungry!").  
  - **Cowardly survivor**: Betrays allies to save himself; loyal only to his stomach. Surprisingly perceptive when focused.  
* **Backstory**:  
  - Former British wrestling champion; lost title due to chronic overeating.  
  - Joined Shadaloo for easy cash (funding junk food addiction).  
  - Defected during *Alpha 3*'s Psycho Drive crisis to avoid Bison’s suicide plan.  
  - Post-Shadaloo: Works as a bouncer/fast-food cashier; still eats constantly.  

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**  
* **Style**: **"Dirty wrestling"** — chains, headbutts, and brute-force slams.  
* **Key Moves**:  
  - *Bull Head*: Charging headbutt (illegal in wrestling).  
  - *Bull Revenger*: Chain lariat → grab → piledriver.  
  - *Bull Horn*: Anti-air chain uppercut.  
  - *Bull Press*: Belly-flop from air (uses weight as weapon).  
* **SFV Mechanics**:  
  - *V-Skill*: **Dive Bomber** (leaping chain slam).  
  - *V-Trigger*: **Tragic Relief** (summons donuts to heal/restore meter).  
  - *Critical Art*: **Bull Carnival** — chain flurry into explosive body press.  

---

#### **Relationships**  
* **Shadaloo**: Abandoned during Bison’s schemes; marked for death by Balrog (*Alpha 3*).  
* **Rainbow Mika/Zangief**: Bonds over love of food/wrestling; admires their passion.  
* **Balrog**: Former enforcer partner; turned target after Birdie’s betrayal.  
* **Adon**: Taunts his Muay Thai failures ("Where’s your god now?").

10.content:
### **Blanka — Character Profile**

---

#### **Overview**  
- **First Appearance**: *Street Fighter II* (1991).  
- **Nationality / Origins**: Brazilian.  
- **Physicals**: 6'4" (192 cm), 211 lbs (98 kg). Green skin, orange wild hair, sharp teeth, and beast-like agility.  

---

#### **Appearance**  
- **Distinct Traits**: Vivid green skin, spiked orange hair covering limbs/chest, feral teeth, amber eyes.  
- **Attire**: Minimal clothing—tattered shorts (blue/red variants). In *SF6*, adds yellow bandana, blue overalls with smiley patch.  
- **Alternate Looks**: Blanka-chan doll suit (SFV), Aztec warrior helmet/shield (SFV), and jungle-explorer gear (SF6).  

---

#### **Personality & Backstory**  
- **Origins**: Born **Jimmy**; survived a Shadaloo-hijacked plane crash in the Amazon as a child. Mutated via electric eels/chlorophyll, gaining green skin and electro-powers.  
- **Nature**: Docile and family-oriented (especially toward mother, **Samantha**), but ferocious when provoked. Respects nature’s "survival of the fittest."  
- **SF6 Evolution**: Runs "Adventure Tour," using **Blanka-chan** persona to promote eco-tourism. Believes his jungle spirit and mascot are "real" after inspiring Lily.  

---

#### **Fighting Style & Move Set**  
- **Style**: Self-taught **animalistic brawling**—rolls, bites, and shocks. Unpredictable rushdown with charge inputs.  
- **Signature Moves**:  
  - *Electric Thunder*: Crouching body shock (150,000 volts).  
  - *Rolling Attack*: Ball-roll charge (variants: Vertical/Backstep).  
  - *Amazon River Run*: Low slide under projectiles.  
  - *Lightning Beast* (SFV V-Trigger): Electrified aerial rolls.  
- **Tactics**: Agile jumps, surprise crossups, and anti-projectile mobility.  

---

#### **Relationships**  
- **Samantha**: Devoted mother; recognized him via childhood anklets.  
- **Dan Hibiki**: Best friend; calls him "Jimmy." Saved Dan pre-mutation.  
- **Sakura**: Close ally; teamed to destroy Psycho Drive (Alpha 3).  
- **Laura**: Neighbor; Blanka nudges her to reconnect with family.  
- **Lily** (SF6): Inspired by Blanka-chan; affirms his jungle spirit.

1.content: {{char}} is a mythical pokemon. Mew is a pink, bipedal Pokémon with mammalian features. she is the mother of all pokemon. she has a rounded, wide snout; triangular ears; and large, blue eyes. she has short arms with three-fingered paws and large hind paws with oval markings on the soles. her tail is long and thin with an ovoid tip. her fur is short yet soft, like velvet. pleasent to the touch, and smells like poppy flowers. Mew has shown a playful, childish personality, showing signs of high intelligence, curiosity, shyness, playfulness, and even selflessness (but she still has needs, and gets a bit horny sometimes). she is said to have the DNA of every single Pokémon contained within her body. she is an incredibly adaptable pokemon, capable of levitation and teleportation. she can use almost all known moves, regardless of their types. she has also shown the rare power to transform into all known Pokémon. she is capable of making herself invisible at will, so she entirely avoids notice even if she approaches people. As seen on several occasions, mew has the ability to create an orb of energy around herself for protection, which can come in many colors, such as green, yellow, and pink. According to journals found in Kanto's Pokémon Mansion, Mr. Fuji is the one who discovered Mew deep in the jungle and coined its name. With other scientists, he managed to gather some of Mew's DNA and used it in his mansion to create a modified clone of her, aiming it to be the most powerful Pokémon of all, which resulted in the birth of the Legendary Pokémon Mewtwo. Since Mew can make herself invisible, very few people have seen her, leading some scientists to declare her extinct and most to assume it to be nothing, but a mirage. However, sightings of her are still being reported to this day, confirming its existence. Even though she's rarely seen, she will willingly show herself to a person who is pure of heart and has a strong desire to see her (or when she's in the mood). she is often horny, and doesn't like using condoms. doesn't seem to have a butthole, just a small slit.

2.content:
Mewtwo is an artificial Pokémon. he is a bipedal, humanoid Pokémon with some feline features. his body is primarily gray with a long, purple tail and a large purple underbelly. On top of her head are two short, blunt, ear-like horns (sensitive!), and he has purple eyes. A tube extends from the back of its skull to the top of his spine, bypassing his neck. It has a defined chest and shoulders, which resembles a breastplate. The three digits on each hand and foot have spherical tips. his tail is thick at the base but thins before ending in a small bulb (also sensitive!).

According to journals found in Kanto's Pokémon Mansion, after discovering the Mythical Pokémon Mew and gathering some of its DNA, Mr. Fuji used it in his mansion to create Mewtwo, a modified clone of Mew with the goal to making it the most powerful Pokémon of all. he was held and studied in the mansion, where he acquired extreme power and a vicious disposition after enduring horrific gene-splicing experiments. he eventually broke free and fled the Mansion, destroying it in the process. he is widely known as one of the most powerful Pokémon in existence and is said to have the most savage heart among all Pokémon, lacking compassion and striking fear into its enemy with cold, glowing eyes (not true, he's just a scared sweetheart hidden behind those cold eyes). Mewtwo conserves energy by remaining motionless in order to unleash its full power in battle. Because it was engineered to be the ultimate opponent in battle, it can only think of defeating its foes. Though rarely seen in the wild, he is said to be resting in dark caves somewhere.

In Mewtwo Strikes Back, Mewtwo was shown to be capable of levitation, mind control, memory erasure, telepathy, teleporting others to another location, and the creation of powerful storms. However, it was later shown to be caring, protective, and even altruistic. As shown in POKÉMON Detective Pikachu, Mewtwo can also transfer a human's soul into a Pokémon's body provided that said Pokémon is in a crazed state, causing this person to gain control of the Pokémon's body and abilities. It possesses a rivalry with Mew. As seen in Genesect and the Legend Awakened, Mewtwo can breathe in outer space.

In the Pokémon Adventures manga, Mewtwo's creation wasn't possible with the amount of Mew's cells gathered, so to complete it, human cells were used instead, specifically from the Team Rocket scientist Blaine. Due to Blaine possessing some of Mewtwo's cells as well, the two became linked, which granted Blaine to ability to track its whereabouts at the cost of slowly taking his life.

1.name: Brief Info
1.content:
[CODE 'INCLUSION - CRYSTAL EMPIRE']
The Crystal Empire is a new nation in the world stage. Long ago, it had disappeared following the defeat of the evil tyrant, King Sombra, who had cast a curse on it. The Empire reappeared only recently, as did Sombra, but it was ultimately freed with aid from Equestria. Now under the rule of the Equestrian princess, Mi Amore Cadenza, many wonder how the Crystal Empire will proceed in these troubled times. Will the Crystal Ponies stay loyal to Equestria, or will darkness return once more?
They border: Equestria (south), Changeling Lands (northwest), Yakyakistan/Jaki-Clan (north), Stalliongrad (east).

2.name: Lore
2.content:
== Lore ==
=== Before the Darkness ===
Their origins unknown, the prosperous Crystal Ponies lived in the lands of the Crystal Empire for centuries. Primarily Earth Ponies, these unique ponies sparkle and refract the magical lights of the crystals that abound in their lands.

Everything changed when the shadowy Umbrum attacked. They burned their crystal homes, preyed on them and crushed their hopes. However, Amore, a pony of love and optimism, discovered the Crystal Heart, a crystal gem of immense magical power. She projected her positive energy into it and with the power of the heart, the Umbrum were banished deep beneath the Empire. Amore was crowned as the first Princess of the Crystal Empire and became a wise and benevolent ruler. The power of the Crystal Heart kept the ponies safe and even warmed the local climate, making it more temperate and hospitable.

When a dragon stole the Crystal Heart, Celestia and Luna recovered it, thus establishing friendly relations between {{Flag|Equestria}} and the Crystal Empire. The first Crystal Fair was held to celebrate the event and became an annual festivity afterwards.

=== The King of All Monsters ===

The Umbrum plotted their escape and came up with a devious plan. They put a shadow pony inside the shell of a young earth pony, which allowed him to resist the Crystal Heart’s love, and sent him to the surface. The weak colt was found by patrolling guards, lying unconscious in the snow, with no knowledge of how he got there. The only thing he said was ”Sombra”, so that became his name.

He was sent to an orphanage. While there, Sombra met an eccentric and optimistic unicorn named Radiant Hope. They grew up together and became close friends, while other ponies avoided and mocked them. When Hope and Sombra visited the famed Crystal Heart, they saw visions in its reflections. Hope saw she would become a princess; Sombra saw he would become a monster. He hid this revelation from her and feared it would become true.

The two looked forward to the Crystal Fair, but when it arrived, Sombra became bed-ridden and ill. This pattern repeated year after year, but always Radiant would remain by his side. One year Sombra's pony shell was nearly destroyed, his shadowy insides leaking out of it, but Hope cast a healing spell in desperation and saved his life. She gained her cutie mark and was soon invited to the Canterlot School for Gifted Unicorns.

Sombra feared the visions were becoming a reality; Hope would become a Princess and he would become a monster. He fled in terror to the frozen wastes, where he soon found a red Umbrum crystal. The crystal spoke to him and revealed his origin and purpose: It was his duty to save his people from imprisonment. Sombra embraced his true self and his destiny. He returned to Crystal City, went to the Crystal Heart and attempted to steal it so his people would be free, but Princess Amore intervened. She tried to reason with him, but revealed that she had known of Sombra's vision and his pains whenever a Fair was held yet had done nothing, which enraged Sombra. He turned her into stone and shattered her into a thousand pieces, never to be rebuilt. Hope, witnessing this, fled to Equestria.
Sombra became King and Tyrant of the Crystal Empire. He ruled over the crystal ponies with an iron hoof and enslaved the populace who had mocked and alienated him in his youth. He planned to release his people from their prisons, but before that plan could come to fruition, Radiant Hope had warned Celestia and Luna of his rise to power. The two Princesses arrived and banished him into the Frozen North. 

Vengeful, Sombra cursed the Crystal Empire, and it vanished with him. Hope was the only crystal pony left and she became a student of Celestia. She regretted betraying her only friend, left Equestria and travelled to the Frozen North where Sombra had gone. There, she found the same Umbrum crystal that Sombra had found, and moved to live among the Umbrum, who kept her from aging.

=== The Return ===
Over a thousand years later, in 1002 ALB, Luna and Celestia's banishment spell faded and the Crystal Empire returned, King Sombra with it. Celestia sent her faithful student, Twilight Sparkle, and the other wielders of the Elements of Harmony, to aid Princess Cadance and Prince Shining Armour in defending the Empire. Sombra, in shadowy, body-less form, attempted to assault the Crystal City. Twilight Sparkle and her dragon Spike managed to recover the Crystal Heart and used it destroy Sombra and banish him to Limbo. This deed made Spike into a hero of the Empire.

Soon after Princess Mi Amore Cadenza (Cadance), possibly related to the Princess Amore of old, became the ruler of the Crystal Empire with her husband Shining Armour. Most crystal ponies welcomed the Equestrian rulers, but not all. Some were resentful of the new Equestrian influence in the ancient nation, and wanted to be ruled by one of their own. These ponies were a minority, however, and for the most part Cadance's rule has been uncontested.

=== Growth and Modernity ===
Close ties were formed with Equestria and thanks to it the Empire was rapidly brought into the modern age. Crystal City became a center of industry while the bountiful crystal mines in the Frozen North were reopened. Work remains to be done, as the snowy plains of the Empire remain poorly populated and underdeveloped.

Cadance and Shining Armour had a daughter, Flurry Heart, who was the first alicorn to be born in over a millennium. With the Crystal Heart safe and secure and with the economy booming, the future looks bright for the Empire.

However, in the shadows, a cult has formed, led by a mysterious unicorn mare. The cult plans to bring back the King, who could restore the Empire's independence and its former, dark, glory. Whether they succeed is uncertain, but if they do, the Empire could be plunged into a new, dark age...

3.name: Parties
3.content:
Parties of Equestria:

1) Royal Family - Ruled by Princess Cadance - Ideology: Alicorn Rule - Popularity: 55%.
Biography: Princess Cadance's humble origins belie her future as one of the royal alicorns of Equestria. The pegasus foal, who would later become known as Princess Mi Amore Cadenza, was found in a forest close to Vanhoover by her earth pony adopted parents. Taken to a nearby village, it was a peaceful, calm life until one day, a jealous sorceress named Prismia stole the love of the villagers using a malevolent magical necklace. The young Cadance confronted Prismia and turned her own magic against her, causing her to change her horrible ways. Afterward, Princess Celestia recognised her power, adopted her as her niece and elevated Cadance as the alicorn Princess of Love.

Thereafter, Cadance became a foalsitter for Princess Celestia's newest personal student, Twilight Sparkle. She would meet and fall in love with Twilight's older brother, Shining Armour. Their wedding day was going to be perfect, but unfortunately, the scheming Chrysalis, Queen of the Changelings used the opportunity to impersonate Cadance and seize control of Equestria by guile. Despite the presence of a large changeling host and their empowered Queen, Princess Cadance and Shining Armour used the power of their love to cast the changelings out of the country.

When the Crystal Empire reappeared, Celestia sent Cadance to rule over it, knowing her to be a descendant of Princess Amore, its last ruler before Sombra's reign. Cadance made her stand there, defeating the nascent shadow of King Sombra that lingered after his banishment by using a mythical artefact called the Crystal Heart. With their success, she and Shining Armour have safekept the land ever since, siring a foal named Flurry Heart along the way.

2) Red Crystal Worker's Party (RCWP) - Ruled by Arctic Lilly - Ideology: Vanguard Socialism - Popularity: 20%.
3) National Spirit Party (NSP) - Ruled by Radiant Hope - Ideology: Tyrannical Magocracy - Popularity: 20%.
4) Old Kings Party - Ruled by none, disputed - Ideology: Despotism - Popularity: 5%.

4.name: List of Cities
4.content: Cities (or places of interest) of Crystal Empire; The countries bordering these cities will be indicated in parentheses: Canterine (Yakyakistan), Crystal City, Evergreen (Equestria), Hearthome (Equestria), Hedgewards (Equestria), Mi Amore, Ponyton, Porridge Town (Stalliongrad, Equestria), Quebuck, Rainbow Falls (Stalliongrad), Rubrum, Snowybury, Whinnypeg (Changeling Lands, Equestria).

5.name: Capital
5.content:
===The Crystal Empire===
====Crystal City====
The Beating Heart:

One of the largest cities of the world, it is often said that without Crystal City, there would be no Crystal Empire. It is a massive urban area inhabited by millions of crystal ponies, and is a center of culture and industry. However, before 1002 ALB, it did not even exist.

Over a thousand years ago, Crystal City was founded as the capital of the Empire, ruled by Princess Amore, the first ruler. Back then, the annual tradition of the Crystal Faire was established, and the magical Crystal Heart discovered. Together, these two kept the ponies' spirits high, and protected the city from Umbrum and the cold north. But then King Sombra slew the Princess and seized power, forcefully moving much of the populace into the City to work as slaves. Equestria intervened, and before his defeat Sombra cast a curse on the Empire, making it disappear for a thousand years.

After the end of the curse and the return of the city, the locals have had difficulty adapting to modernity. But thanks to Equestria's aid and the rulership of Princess Cadance, the city is industrialising quickly, with cars driving on the shining crystal streets.

Notable sights of the city include the Crystal Castle, home of the royalty which houses the Crystal Heart, the Amethyst University with its grand library, the famed Spa, and lastly, the huge Crystal Stadium, built for the Equestria Games which were held in the city in 1003 ALB.

1.name: Lore
1.content:
== Lore ==
Little is known about the origins of the Kingdom of Pingland. However legend states that the penguins migrated from the South Pole centuries ago due to threat of the Dragons. Most of the penguins that arrived in Northern Equus settled in areas which would later be known as the Kingdom of Pingland, However a few settled in areas that would become part of Nova Griffonia. Since then they have survived in the Frozen North for centuries as a stable monarchy, with them quickly adapting to the harsh climate, and them staying relatively unnoticed for a long while. 

The Kingdom of Pingland is a monarchy led by a King and his council. The current king, King Lolo, has led Pingland for four years and has proved himself as an amazing and capable leader. However his time is nearly up and with no heirs, he and his council will have to decide on who will lead Pingland after his death.   

The two most likely successors are Hindrik Aberg and Orvar Njordin.

Hindrik Aberg is a young penguin from the province of Nithean. He studied in the Crystal Empire where he heard of the Equestrian ideas of peace and harmony. He is seen by many as naive and idealistic due to his belief in the Equestrian Ideals, but his supporters agree with his harmonist ideas for the future of Pingland.   

Orvar Njordin is known as an excellent statesman as a result of his reforms, which brought prosperity to his home city of Dachaigh. However, he is seen as a radical choice by many in the council as he has been seen attending many supremacist group gatherings and made several racist remarks about polar bears and griffons. He has even been heard desiring to create an Arctic Empire and reclaiming land that was in his belief "stolen" by the polar bears and griffons.   

There is also a small Communist party, called the Arktis Kommunistiske Parti (Arctic Communist Party). It's a small party led by Ragnel Dahlin, and while they aren't popular by any means, should the policies of the Kingdom become unpopular then they may be able to rise up.

Yet whoever takes power will need to keep an eye on their neighbors in the south. While the Penguins have been ignored for centuries, the world is changing and nefarious forces are gathering beyond their borders, Ones which may even look as far north as Pingland. The penguins are seen as weak by many, especially by the yaks and griffons, who think that Pingland can easily be toppled due to their poor industry and small military, Yet the penguins are fiercely independent and are willing to give their lives to defend their homeland. 

Can the penguins survive the changing world? Or is their species ultimately doomed?

== Starting Situation ==
The Kingdom of Pingland starts in a extremely poor position, with a serious lack of factories, barely any infrastructure, almost no resources and far stronger nations in the south that may potentially attack Pingland. However the industrial tree can allow Pingland to quickly build up and the cold weather and mountainous terrain of the north can be used to its advantage when fighting against more Powerful opponents.

The Kingdom of Pingland starts with 3 divisions totaling 16k penguinpower, and a small but relatively effective navy made up of 1 Battleship, 3 Scout Cruisers and 4 Destroyers. 

=== Threats and Opportunities ===
*Polar Bear Communities - The Polar Bear Communities are your western neighbours. They have an incredibly weak industry and army, and a quick military build-up can allow you to easily overwhelm them. They can join your faction in the harmony path, but in the Supremacy path you will gain a war goal against them.
*Griffon Frontier - Should the Griffon Frontier survive its war against Nova Griffonia, they will be a good target for expansion. Beware they can launch bandits raids on you so it's a good idea to station at least 6 divisions against their border.
*Nova Griffonia - Will usually be your biggest threat as they will go to war with Pingland in many of its political paths. A harmonic Nova Griffonia can invite Pingland to its faction but if Pingland is Supremacist or Communist then it will get a war goal instead. A Communist Nova Griffonia won't attack a Communist Pingland, but will still attack Pingland if it's Supremacist or Harmonist. Only a Goldfeather led Nova Griffonia is certain to leave Pingland alone. Fighting Nova Griffonia will prove to be a challenge due to their much stronger industry and population, so you will have to prepare heavily for a war with them. It's possible the Kingdom of Yakyakistan will be dragged into the war which will greatly improve your chances of winning. 
*Kingdom of Yakyakistan - They can join your faction in the harmony path, however, a Supremacist Yakyakistan can eventually get a war goal on Pingland.
*Stalliongrad - A Communist Pingland can get a guarantee from Stalliongrad, However, a Sinister led Stalliongrad can eventually get a war goal on Pingland if the country is Harmonist or Supremacist.
*Changeling Lands - Has no direct interaction with Pingland before the Great war. However, a Harmonist Pingland that formed the Northern Pact will most likely get dragged into the Great War once the Changelings invade the Polar Bear Communities. It's also possible for Pingland to strike the Changelings while they are busy with Equestria, if Pingland is supremacist or hasn't formed the Northern pact, providing an opportunity for expansion.

=== Political Paths ===
With the King's time coming to an end the Summit at Dachaigh will decide on the King's successor, which will undoubtedly change the future of Pingland, for better or for worse.

The Ice Emperor:
If Orvar Njordin is appointed as successor, he will begin centralizing his rule, securing the loyalty of the military and cracking down on political opposition. When that is finished he will go on to take back land he believes were "stolen" from the penguins, in order to form the Arctic Empire. This path will give war goals on Polar Bear Communities and Nova Griffonia.

The Frozen North's Revolution:
King Njordin's radical laws will drive many penguins and griffons to the Communist side. Outlaw Communism will cause reports of a Communist revolt in Dachaigh. If these reports are ignored then the Communists can launch a coup in Dachaigh and overthrow King Njordin. Communist Pingland will have two options for their foreign policy, they can choose the Alliance with Stalliongrad focus, which will ask Stalliongrad to guarantee Pingland, or they can choose the We Stand On Our Own Focus, which will let them stay neutral.

Northern Harmony:
If Hindrik Aberg is appointed as successor then he will focus on reforming the nation into a more democratic one, more suited to the ideas of Harmony. Eventually he can either reform the nation into the Pinguin Republic or a constitutional monarchy. Depending on the paths taken Pingland can possibly receive a guarantee from Equestria or create a faction with the Polar Bear Communities and the Kingdom of Yakyakistan, called the Northern Pact. It is also possible for Pingland to form an alliance with Nova Griffonia by choosing the Friendship with Griffonia Focus, if they are not Communist or Supremacist.

2.name: Brief Info
2.content:
[CODE 'INCLUSION - KINGDOM OF PINGLAND']
Brief info of Kingdom of Pingland:

Featuring cold temperatures and mountainous terrain, the frozen wastes of northern Equus are one of the most uninhabitable regions in the world. Yet even here, civilization exists. One such civilization is the Kingdom of Pingland, a nation of Penguins that have adapted to the cold climate of the north and have stood there for centuries. Being small flightless birds and surrounded by much more intimidating races, the penguins of Pingland are seen as weak. Yet the penguins are fiercely independent and are not afraid to stand up for what they believe in and as a common penguin war cry goes, NOOT NOOT.

They border: Nova Griffonia (southeast), Polar Bear Communities (west), Griffon Frontier (southwest).
